name: Laura Aldridge
text: Friendly and professional service. Worked quickly and neatly. I will definitely use them again.

name: Tara Tittlemouse
text: I can not say enough positive things about this company. I recently used them to repair my washing machine, and I couldn't be more pleased. Lee was my tech, and was so professional and competent it was a breath of fresh air in these times. They are so good to keep up communication with you about your appointment, texting so that you are kept informed every step of the way, and really care about their customers and their experience.  Prices are good, too and they were masked up and continued to make sure I had no concerns and was happy with every aspect of service they provided. Please give these folks a call if you ever need anything serviced because I have never dealt with any repair company this exceptional across the board. Dependable,  prompt, efficient, clean and competent with good prices to boot. 5 stars, indeed! Thanks again, y'all!

name: Gary Skovira
text: The Tech was very knowledgeable and professional.  He is very good at his job.

name: Theresa Taylor
text: Very helpful. Responded very promptly. Would definitely use again.

name: Lisa Brown
text: our repairman was so nice and got it fixed within 30 mins. very professional

name: don str
text: Freezer was working. It fridge was not cold. The fan that blows cold air into fridge from freezer had quit working. Tech had part on his truck and had it going in a short time. He cleaned up his area and had fridge back into place.

name: Willa Burleson
text: These people are the best.  Tell you when they will be there and are. Very nice to deal with. They know their business. Very trustworthy and knowledgeable. Not too pricey.

name: McKayla Aswell
text: The tech that came to my house was very professional. He took off his shoes before entering my house. He got to work right away and was able to find the problem. He was honest on the cost to order new parts and recommended it was much cheaper to buy a new one than to temporarily fix the current fridge.

name: Ashley Tombyll
text: Quick response and great repair work.  He had our dryer back up and running in no time.  Very friendly and professional.

name: Dan Prince
text: Explained everything each step of the way. Gave an appointment reminder with notice that they were on their way. Especially like the one year warranty but doubt it will be needed.

name: Jimmy Huddleston
text: I was very pleased with the service.  They arrived when they said they would be there.  They sent a picture of the technician in uniform that was coming. Fixed dryer. Good experience and would use them again, if needed.

name: Thomas Graves
text: Replaced valve  for icemaker, did a great job!

name: Carolyn Unger
text: They were on time, professional, and finished the job responsibly.

name: Hal Williams
text: Mr Appliance serviced our LG washer. He was extremely polite and informed. We will definitely use them again.

name: Cindy Phillips
text: On time, professional, made all repairs needed.

name: Elzie Ellis
text: Dryer not working. Called Mr Appliance. They set up timely and prompt service call. E-mail sent to me reflecting repair date I had chosen and showing a 2-hour time frame they would show up -- with the name and a  photo of the technician. He showed up at scheduled time, repaired my dryer, and I was charged a very fair price for the part and labor charged. This was the 2nd time I had used Mr Appliance, and I will continue to use Mr Appliance for future problems I may have. Very professional!

name: Kim
text: He was so helpful and on time,courteous, and reasonable with pricing.

name: Cheryl Tincknell
text: Lee came to look at my washer today. He was very personable and professional. I was really afraid this was going to cost a lot of money which I do not have. Cost was very reasonable. He explained everything in detail. Come to find out he is the owner. I was more than happy with with the service and recommend Mr Appliance to anyone. Thank you, Cheryl

name: Michele Broadfoot
text: Prompt and friendly.  Will definitely use them again!!

name: Daniel Michael
text:
I only call Lee Simmons. He is extremely friendly and helpful. Lee was an excellent and knowledgeable service tech. I would recommend mr. appliance any day, based on the tech alone!
Great service.
Quick response
Knowledgeable

name: Gary Stephens
text: We had a gas range that broke down 2 days before Thanksgiving. We called Mr. Appliance and Lee worked us into his schedule the next day. Unfortunately the range was 30 years old and parts were discontinued. Lee spent time looking at local appliance stores for gas ranges and their prices. After this he did not charge for his service call because he had repaired the range last year. ( a different problem ). I highly recommend Lee and his company.

name: Kay Kime
text: Can't say enough about this company. Mr Simmonds went above and beyond to ensure my refrigerator was repaired. He even called the manufacturer to get two parts that were defective replaced at no  cost.  They are super friendly and arrive on time.  Great company

name: teresa russ
text: Excellent service. Lee was great. He went above and beyond.

name: Matthew Thomas
text: Lee was quick to respond, highly professional, and efficient.  He diagnosed the problem with our dishwasher, hot water heater, and refrigerator within a few minutes. Every appliance was fixed in a timely manner. Thank you Lee.

name: Madilyn Tidwell
text: Verify prompt and professional service. Verify friendly and helpful with repair. Highly recommend this company

name: Belin Bodie
text: Mr Appliance  fixed our 35 year old washer and dryer.  They are running like tops.  Very professional!  Very knowledgeable!  So happy they could come to our area to do our repairs. Always appointment time kept.  We would definitely use them again. Charges were fair.  Mr Simmons was so wonderful to work with.  Don't hesitate,  have Mr Appliance come and fix your appliance. You will be glad you did!

name: Carolyn Brown
text: Very professional and reasonably priced. Repair also has with 1 year warranty on part and labor

name: Paul Harris
text: Mr. Appliance took care of our issue quickly. We had been dealing with another appliance repair shop for over 6 weeks and they had no clue wanted to replace our ice maker when that really was not the problem. I would recommend Mr. appliance to anyone that has a appliance problem. They do great work.

name: Lee James
text: very helpful, considerate, great at explaining

name: Danielle Morgan
text: I will be recommend Mr. Lee Simmons for any appliance repair . He came right out and looked at my washer told me what i needed ordered it for me came in the next day and got straight to work putting it on!!! Excellent customer service!!!

name: Karen Griffith
text: Highly professional friendly technician. Honestly love these guys. Gets your repairs done in a very timely manner and the best part is they warranty their work... Highly Recommend them for all your home appliance repairs.

name: Paul Gusmus
text: Technician calls to confirm arrival time and is prompt, courteous and professional. Diagnosed problems and provides estimate before proceeding. Only after you approve does he begins repairs. Good job and satisfied with experience.

name: Rick Davis
text: Lee with Mr. Appliance always provides prompt and trustworthy service. I have used him several times and been very satisfied each time.

name: starlon2u
text: You were at my home timely.  The serviceman was very nice but professional.  He went right to work, discovered what the problem was and ordered the part.  He returned on a Saturday (commendable) to install the part.  Refrigerator up and running! Will definitely recommend using Mr. Appliance!! Thank you.

name: Leslie Griffin
text: Lee Simmons with Mr Appliance has been very prompt, knowledgeable, courteous and honest in his assessment and repair of our appliances.  I highly recommend his services!

name: Mark Potts
text: My daughter is a student at UNA in Florence, AL and I received the call that every Dad gets when something is not working. On this particular occasion it was the dryer is not heating. I did the typical research on-line and decided this was more than I cared to attempt. With that said, I contacted Mr. Appliance and they had a technician out the very next day. Not only was the service prompt but Mr. Appliance sent a text to my daughter and me with a photo of the technician and his name, "a great idea which puts one at ease when they know who is going to be knocking on their door."  Within an hour, I received a call to inform me what was wrong and how much it would cost to fix it. The price was more than reasonably and the service was excellent. Dryer was not only repaired (Thermal cutoff replaced) , but the technician went the extra mile and cleaned out the inside of the dryer and the vent as well. I highly recommend Mr. Appliance for "Expert Appliance Repair".

name: J B
text: I called Mr. Appliance and within a few hours a technician was at my house diagnosing the problem with my refrigerator.  I had a bad sensor that had to be ordered, he had the parts the next day.  He came out replaced the sensor and it runs great.  I will use them again and highly recommend them.

name: Nicole Sneed
text: Professional and great service!

name: Doree Pettus
text: Very polite and professional. I was very pleased with the service.

name: vonda sams
text: Professional, Punctual, Security conscious for customers 'loved that'.Honesty ,Integrity . I now have my "Go To " company for all my appliance repairs.

name: Lisa Tidwell
text: Very impressed with the service we received. Came and fixed washing machine same day he said he would even though he had a time consuming job right before mine and had to work late. And by the way, I was contacted to let me know he was behind but still coming to fix my machine. Thank you Mr Lee Simmons.

name: Ken Senes
text:
Update: Called SEARS again on May 24th to see if an earlier appointment could be made to install the part that had been ordered (I had called a week earlier to see if it would be possible to get someone to come out sooner than the almost 3 weeks I had previously been told that it would take to get someone to my house to put in the part). Well, to my surprise, this time I was told they could send out a serviceman the very next day (which they did). The repairman was very courteous and knowledgeable.....and the dryer has now been repaired.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Did not show up for first service call. Said truck broke down but we never received a call. Sears said they texted us...but upon further investigation, Sears said they transposed our telephone #, so who knows who received the message that said they weren't going to show up. Wasted one day waiting for repair man. Then after almost 2 weeks later, a repairman finally shows up. He was nice enough and seemed to know what he was doing. Said that a part would need to be ordered. Okay, fair enough. Part came in almost two weeks later; however, was told it will be almost another 3 weeks before Sears can send someone out to install the part. Customer service??? I don't think so. Bottom line: Almost 7 weeks without a dryer that's under Sear's Home Warranty program is a very POOR indicator of this company's ability to honor their agreement. Still waiting for June 9th to get here. Hope they show up. Signed, "Not holding my breath."

resp.text: Thank you, Ken Senes, for taking the time to provide us with your rating and review. We are sorry to hear you have not had a good experience with us. If you would please message us with the name, address, and phone number that is associated with this issue to our Sears Home Services Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/SearsHomeServices/, we will be able to see how we can help out. Please reference this review in your message, thank you

He was exceptionally professional and within minutes knew what was wrong with my oven. He had to return as the part I needed had to be ordered. The same service was repeated. I will definitely use excel for any appliance problem I may have in the future.

Afterwards, he showed me what he had done and demonstrated that the dryer was working properly.  I'll definitely be calling him for all future appliance repairs!!!

text: He only received 5 stars because that's all you can give. Prompt and excellent service. Will call on him for any future appliance repair.

text: Excel Appliance Repair gives outstanding service at a VERY affordable price! It is so hard to find someone to trust with your repair needs! Do not hesitate to call them!

text: Excellent service!  With my hectic schedule, Hal was easy and very cooperative about scheduling the appointment around me.  And a bit early.  Pleasant person and quick repair.  Highly recommend this business!

text: I don’t know that I’ve ever received such prompt service. Although it would cost more for a dryer motor than buying a new one, Hal came, as promised, ON LABOR DAY!! Who does that these days? There is a reason for all the FIVE STAR reviews!

name: Donna Tingle
text: The serviceman came out to check our washer...and was right on time...let us know when he would be arriving...received great thorough service...but the washer was beyond hope...he even told us about where to get some surge protectors for our appliances...very pleased with his knowledge and service of our washer...Will definitely call him again if we need him...shame I couldn't give him ten stars...

name: Peggy
text: I called Excel with a dryer problem and could not believe the quick response we received.  Hal was at my house within 24 hours of the call and diagnosed the problem right away.  He is very knowledgeable, professional and has the best customer service that we have ever received.  Could never recommend this company enough!  I have found my go to repair service that is truly deserving of this 5 stare rating!!

name: Peggy Howland
text: Called for a dryer repair on a Saturday and Hal was out here within an hour and repair was made quickly and reasonably priced. He also was very professional and I would recommend this company to everyone. So very glad it was recommended to me.

name: Lorraine Ireland-Frye
text: Great service , price was very reasonable and they actually communicate with the customer .i will definitely recommend. And on time which is a plus for me .

I really appreciated when he took the time to answer all of my questions. He was extremely knowledgeable on all the appliances he has worked on for me. I would highly recommend him to anyone.

name: Miguel Mello

name: Kendra Crabbe
text: Fast and comprehensive service -- my Maytag dryer would spin and not heat. Other companies told me they could come out in 3-5 days. My dryer was fixed within 36 hours with Excel Appliance Repair! Our technician replaced the heating element and graciously vacuumed the interior parts out so hopefully our dryer will work efficiently for a good long time!

name: Edward Cook
text: Hal did a great job on my refrigerator. I noticed something was wrong it, called Hal and he determined it was serious enough to handle quickly. Great service and reasonably priced. Very professional and knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thank you Mr Cook, honored to serve you. Call again.

name: roger yates
text: Best repair service I have ever used. Prompt,  courteous, and very efficient. Would recommend to anyone who needs fast affordable appliance repair.

name: Randy Eiland
text: Hal does excellent work. He is timely, efficient and reasonable in his charges. He follows up with his customers after his work is done to insure satisfaction with his service. Definitely in my speed dial.

name: Dana Snellgrove

text: My experience was GREAT! I made one phone call and left a message, and I received a call back within 10 minutes. The repair man stated he could be at my house within 15 minutes, and he was there exactly as he stated he would! Within 15 minutes, he had my refrigerator back running as if nothing ever happened. Professional, friendly, and fast service is what’s guaranteed with this company! I would highly recommend them to anyone!

text: MANY MANY THANKS TO EXCEL APPLIANCE REPAIR.  he deserves , and earned , the five star rating on his site.  he came right over, fixed my refrigerator, VERY REASONABLE.  i will give him a five star rating on work, customer service, and just a nice fellar.  if you need   a technician, i will recommend him .  John Martin

name: Dorothy Hudley
text: Wow! My experience with Excel was amazing. Hal was prompt, efficient and very affordable. I would recommend Excel to anyone that need their services. Thank you Hal.

name: Brian Poellot
text: I have a Hotpoint dryer that stopped working. I was able to test the start switch and found that it was good. I could not access the dryer door switch, so I called Excel Appliance Repair. Hal asked questions about what the dryer was and wasn't doing. He was able to diagnose the problem as a worn out timer knob. All this while on the phone! I highly recommend Excel Appliance Repair if you have any appliance issues. Hal was extremely interested in trying to narrow down the problem so I could, in his own words, "save money". He was courteous, professional and showed great patience during our phone conversation. He was also quick to respond to my voice mail (within 20 minutes). I won't call anyone else for any future appliance issues I may have.

name: Bayne Heersink
text: Fantastic service, very knowledgeable and realistic when I comes to repair versus replace. Would highly recommend to anyone.

Hal was super nice and came to my house when he said he would and did a great job on repairing my washer at a great price! Hal, of Excel Appliance Repair, has  my business from now on. text: Really love Excel work I love that It was   Immediate service. I didn't have to wait and it was really good custmor service. I Highly recommend everyone to this company price was also reasonable.

text: Amazing service! Thankfully Excel Appliance happened to be in the area. He made a spur of the moment stop to diagnose my refrigerator. text: My washer would not spin. Mr. McClamma came and found out the tub was rusted on. Most repair men would have just said it couldn't be repaired instead of working with it the way he did. He is the only person I will call for any of my appliances.

text: Rudest company I’ve dealt with in Dothan. Take your money somewhere else.

resp.text: I’m sorry you felt that way. I received a refrigerator service request from you about 8:00 this morning. I give refrigerators priority and work them in quickly because of potential food loss even when my schedule is full. I said I could be there sometime this morning. You requested a time estimate.  Due the the nature of appliance repair, I couldn’t provide a better time estimate other than being there within the next 3.5 hours. I was then called rude and not a good person. On a last minute emergency work-in high end refrigerator repair, being in your home within 3.5 hours was the best I could do. I wish I could make everyone happy, and meet & exceed their expectations. My apologies.

His knowledge of the appliance was apparent and he had the refrigerater up and working within minutes of being there.  His price was very good and I would recommend him to my family and friends.    I would say that from the phone call to the repair being finish might have been 1 an 1/2 hours  and I could not have been more pleased! Thank you again, Hal, for putting her mind at ease today.

name: debra gandy debgandy97@yahoo.com
text: I was very pleased with the repair guy. I will use them again and let my friends know about them.

name: James Catman
text:
DISCLAIMER: They do not repair microwaves.

I was given this shop's contact information from another appliance repair shop, stating they are a certified Frigidaire/Electrolux repair shop for the brand. Unfortunately it was just after-hours when I left a message w/ my contact info & details regarding the issue (make/model & problem - dead micro).

After waiting a full week w/ no call-back, I searched for their info online, found their website & phone number, and noticed they do not repair microwaves. Being curious as to why I didn't get a call-back, I called again to inquire.

Their answer?

Messages received after-hours are automatically deleted (or, not saved).

IHMO that is a terrible business practice. As a common courtesy, a better practice would be to at least have any/all after-hours saved, and/or call back the potential client to inform them about what service[s] cannot be performed.

name: Veronica Hill
text: Love the welcome and historic atmosphere

name: Sandy Taylor
text: Have been using their services for years.   Professional,  courteous and knowledgeable.   I recommend them to my friends and neighbors.   A great company!

text: they told me to call someone else.

text:
The guy came out to my house, said that  Frigidaire was a Piece of s#@t, charged
$ 55.00 and left, He did not check anything on it. He said he knew what was wrong with it before he got here, Had a terrible attitude. I vacuumed out the coil, its working fine.

text: Came out quickly, the man was polite and efficient. Would highly recommend.

name: Romona Brown
text: Never returned my call

name: Kelly Parrish
text: Timely, thorough, and professional. Not only was he able to acurately diagnose my appliance problems, but he gave me a ton of tips to keep my appliances operating at optimal performance - I honestly got out paper and pen and took notes! Very polite and trustworthy. Thank you!

name: Traveler T
text: Chris Sanders was a very professional technician who did a great job coming out and assessing the issue, ordered the parts "which were here in a week right before Christmas", and then came out and got my washing machine fixed very fast and it's still working like the day I got it new! Highly recommend Highly recommend S&S Appliance and especially Chris! You all have great customer service and very diligent techs!!

name: Carolyn Garland
text: S & S was called out for service on my old dishwasher. Lisa was very helpful in scheduling at a good time for me (we had to reschedule once). Mike the serviceman was courteous, persistent, diligent, and informative. In spite of a less than optimal situation, he got my dishwasher working again and I am very pleased. These folks know the meaning of "Customer Service".

name: Ryan Madewell
text: Initial service call for washing machine leaking water placed November 26, 2017. Came out a week later to inspect it and ordered the part. We called and called for all the way up to the end of December with them saying, "The part is on back order". We called Whirlpool and ordered it straight to our house in 3 days. Apparently they ordered it through themselves and not the official Whirlpool replacement part center. Anyway we received it on Jan 12 and called to schedule someone to install it.  The earliest they said they could come out would be January 23, 2018 . Almost two months without a washer and the whole thing only has a year warranty. We got a call, the day before, asking to confirm the time. The window they gave us was from 8AM to 12PM. Ridicules as we both work and couldn't take off the day before. So we denied the time hoping we could get a different time. Nope canceled the entire service call. Called again and they said the spot has already been filled (between 5PM and 8:30AM of that night, how?) and the earliest they will come is Friday the 26 with "No guarantee they will make it out there". Shame of business. Wish I could just install it myself but it would void the warranty. Should have just took it back and got a new one.

name: Cathey Story
text: Took 4 days to call me to set up a repair appointment for my dryer! I was told the next Friday they would come. They cancelled the day of! I’ve been with out my dryer 2 weeks because of horrible service. I tried calling them back and I was on hold 12 minutes before I hung up. Do not rec

name: Joy Allen
text: It has been a month and they still have not fixed my dryer.They ordered a motor twice and the woman called and said they would be there on Jan 2016 and I waited from 8 to 1 and called she said they would not be at my house till Thursday. I would never recommend them to anyone ever

name: Brian O'Connell
text: So far the experience has been awful.  The technician has been polite and good as far as I can tell but the business model appears designed to maximize labor costs to the customer or warranty company.  According to the tech damn near all refrigerators are manufactured by a single company in Canada.  Different brands just slap their name on the boxes.  Yet the technical never seems to have the parts to fix anything.  The main power board, solenoid and cooling unit seem like pretty standard things to keep on hand.  Instead they come out on trip one to id a problem.  Then they go back to the office to ask for permission from the warranty company to do something.  Then they get a part in a week. If that part is bad or isn't the only thing wrong they start the process over again.  So we are now three weeks without a refrigerator with no end in sight.  Moreover if they get approval to repair they won't call you to set up the appointment.  Every single time I've had to call them to find out if they received approval or have their parts now.  Only after I call will they set anything up, again pushing things out.  Our tech will be out here for the 4th Monday in a row.  One more visit and I'm going to owe him a free sandwich for visiting 5 times!  Stay away and if your warranty company sends them out ask for a new service provider because this is ridiculous.

name: nathan lawson
text: I'm on my third refrigerator from Frigidaire with the same problem reoccurring they came out did a thorough inspection of the refrigerator and reported everything properly to the manufacture

resp.text: We are so pleased to hear that you had such a positive experience. Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we did. We appreciate any and all feedback. Thank you for choosing Sears!

name: Johnny Numbers
text: Repairman took time to explain details of what he was doing and gave specific and helpful feedback to questions I posed.

resp.text: Thank you Johnny N.for your 5-star rating! We thank you for your business and look forward to serving you again in the future.

name: Julie Lovoy
text: MY REFRIGERATOR IS STILL NOT WORKING!!!!!!! THE REPAIR DID NOT WORK. THE TECH HAS PUT IN SEVERAL REQUESTS FOR THIS MODEL TO BE REPLACED WHICH HAVE ALL BEEN IGNORED.  I HAVE CALLED 2 TIMES ONLY TO BE ON HOLD FOR 2 PLUS HOURS WHICH IS OUTRAGEOUS AND EACH TIME I REACHED A REAL PERSON I WAS CUT OFF!!!!!!!  WHAT HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE YOU HAVE.  YOU OBVIOUSLY DON'T VALUE YOUR CUSTOMERS AT ALL.  NOW I AM STUCK WITH A BROKEN BOTTOM FREEZER/REFRIGERATOR WHICH IS BROKEN AND TAKING UP SPACE.  I SHOULD HAVE NEVER PURCHASED THIS FROM SEARS.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to bring this to our attention, Julie. We hate to see that you have had this kind of experience and would love the opportunity to take a look to see how we can help out. If you would please message the name, address, and phone number that is associated with the service order to our Sears Home Services Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/SearsHomeServices/, we will be able to see how we can help out. We appreciate your business and look forward to assisting you with this matter.

name: Adam Pest
text: Sears came to my home and did a diagnostic test on my washing machine, then said they needed to order a part. Almost a month later after not hearing from them, I received an email saying that my order has been cancelled and that my request had been completed. After calling the help line, they told me that everything was done and that my washer had been fixed, but none of that happened. They took our check for the part, cashed it, then closed our ticket. No one during this process was rude to me in any way, but none of them were helpful in any way. I am absolutely appalled with Sear, and will not be using any of their services ever again because of this.

name: Iman Dayarian
text: I wish I could give 0 stars! My refrigerator is not working. The first available appointment was in 2 weeks, which I booked. The technician came and ran a diagnostic check and told me he needed to order parts. Then I didn't hear back anything. After 3 days, I called and they told me the service was canceled and I have to schedule another one and the next available appointment is in 3 weeks. Who does business like this? I'm simply speechless!

name: Barbara Willis
text: Appointment time of 8 to 5pm is not realistic. Was sent text “ service repair person was on the way” received this at 1245 pm and repair tech showed up at 445pm.

name: David Williamson
text:
Excellent service.
Tech arrived early. Was professional courteous. Explained exactly what he was doing. Explained warranty options. Accepted a 20% off coupon I printed online. Explained payment options. I was very pleased with the entire experience

name: Gene Raburn
text: The repair was done quickly and efficiently on the exact day of the appointment.  It took two trips to actually assess the problem, get the proper part delivered, and the final repair completed.  That seems to be the norm for appliances with such technologically advanced systems to trouble shoot.  Thank you for sending such a well trained and first class technician.

name: Thomas Prewitt
text: The repair went good but it shouldn't take 8 days for a repair person to come out. That is very inconvenient when you have a family of 4 or a if it's just you. I would DEFINITELY hope in the near future you all could be faster in your repair services.

name: Eugene Dirks
text: Technician was nice and courteous. He fixed one problem and ran a diagnostic check and said everything checked out ok but the washer does not spin.

name: Leigh Ann Colvin
text: The Sears technician, Danny was super. The technician completed diagnosis of problem with my front load washer and replaced part. He explained appliance cleaning service offered by Sears. The technician removed front panel of dryer and cleaned large amount of lint from inside. The build up of lint could cause a fire. He also removed back panel of refrigerator and vacuum coils. I was very impressed with technician knowledge about my appliances  and the cleaning service.

name: Kay Dockery
text: It has been almost a month and my washer is still not working!!! Still have not got the part to do the repair.  They say is will be at least another week. This is crazy!!! No on has that many clothes to go that long without a washer.  What is bad, no one seems to care!!!   Sears service has really went down.  I have kept service contracts for over 25 years and it is at its lowest point now!! I have been a loyal customer up to this point.  I think I will try Lowes when my contracts  run out if service does not improve!!! I have contract on everything is my house.

name: spcljac07
text: Set an appointment 2 weeks ago. The repair window was 8am-5pm at 2:41 pm the tech calls to tell me he will be here are 6 pm. At 4:50pm he calls back to say that he will not make it and :maybe " he can come tomorrow.  I call the 877 repairs line to complain about the wasted 9 hour day and I find out the tech, put in the system that he came to the house and no one was home. They can reschedule me for an appointment in 10 days.  Sears wonders why their business is dying. I have done my last business with Sears

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your review. We apologize for the inconvenience you experienced. We understand your frustration and know your time is important. If you would like us to look into this situation further, please email us at SHSSocialcare830@searshc.com with you name, address, and phone number associated with your account. Thank you.  ^AM

name: Sebastian Holcomb
text: I always love shopping here. From the amazing selection of home appliances to the automotive department, Sears is one of the best one-stop shops for everything you need.

name: Robert Morris
text:
Randall the repairman was professional and quick.
In and out within the hour.
Overall good experience.
I would recommend Sears Repair Online Booking to others.
RM

name: Angela Blake
text: Very polite employee..........my washer could only be temporarily fixed, so he fixed it enough so I could do laundry until I can get another washer and only charged me half of the service charge......I have always had a good experience with Sears Appliance Repair!!!!!

name: Virginia Wilson
text: My experience with the technician went well,he explained and showed me  the correct way to turn on the washer to avoid anymore problems.He was very nice and pleasant to talk to and may ai add,the previous technician in January were very nice too,he just forgot to show me how to operate the washer without causing the same problem.I wanted to add that because I didn't get a chance to fill out a survey for his service..Thank You

text: The repair was done quickly and the service man was knowledgable about the issue. I have been very happy with their service.

name: Fox101
text: I miss Sears they had a great selection of tools and appliances.

name: jsejse23
text: Bad experience. Not able to fix my washing machine. The first repair person diagnosed a problem and ordered a part to fix the clutch. When the part came in, a 2nd group of repairmen came to the house. The washer was working, but could only handle light loads when the repairmen came to the house to "fix" the issue and install the new part. After the repairmen installed the new part, the washer will not work at all. At the end of the 2nd service call, I was told that the washer is broken, not fixable, and I will need to buy a new washer. Machine went from working, but only able to run small loads to completely broken. Very unsatisfied.

name: Mike Dickson
text: No one came to repair the washer. Now they have rescheduled it for Nov 16. Another 3 weeks without a washing machine!

resp.text: Hi Mike! We would love to take a look into this for you to see how we can help out with this. name: Mike Oakley
text: Sears has gone terribly downhill in customer response. I say Customer response becuase the Customer Service reps, based in Arizone, were all helpful but there was no "follow-up" to the conversation. Over the course of 20+ days, I was asked the same questions repeatedly and given different "case numbers," none of which helped concerning a dishwasher with warranty. I was told, at one point, that there were no service calls in my area in the next month! There was no issue SELLING the appliance so why is there an issue in upholding a promise?  What DID help was when I went on Social Media and complained and many others complained about Sears. I got a message within a day. When a service rep finally came, after more than a month for a dishwashwer UNDER WARRANTY, he was fairly good.

resp.text: Mike, we regret to hear that you went through so much trouble with your dishwasher issues; however, we are happy to hear that you were able to find assistance with our Social Media team! Please do not hesitate to reach back out to us on the social channels if you need further assistance!

name: Gary Bolen
text:
Here is Sears asking for a " How did I like the service" comment when the  service hasn't been done. My mower's drive belt broke.  And it was time for the annual servicing. So I called and everything went well.  Parts ordered, service time arranged, Life was good. Two weeks later, no parts, no service call.  When I called back to check, the number I was given was not a correct number.  I had to call four times to the service number.  The first time I was transferred four times to get to the correct division for my service contract on my mower.  The fourth person couldn't help me and transferred me back to the third person and they 'dropped' the call.  Two hours 18 minutes... no, I did not call back that day.  Finally got through to the proper division for the mower service contract.  Got the service time set up with my complaint and requested service ordered.

The serviceman arrives and I tell him what I had asked for and he says he was only told about the broken belt.  No new blades, no new cut grass shield, and NO service.  He starts to replace the belt and I quickly saw he did not have the correct belt.  He had been given the belt that turns the blades, not the drive belt.

So off to the hardware store to get the correct belt.  Once he gets back, the drive belt repair was completed quickly.  Two days later, a different service tech comes by to look at the mower to get the numbers to order the shield.   He promises me that he will put in the request for the annual service.  A week later, someone comes out to my house and installs the shield on the mower,  No service, no new blades.  My son and I go get some new blades and put them on ourselves.  At least I can cut grass now.

STILL WAITING ON THE SERVICE.  I would take this back to Sears, but.....

name: Jacque Sherbak
text: Prompt, pleasant and assessed the problem immediately.  He ordered the part and installed it within a week.  Our beeping refrigerator was silent once again.  Very reasonable time.  We found it very helpful that Sears is now sending parts to the repair shops instead of customer homes.  This allows repair to contact us with a time in mind.  Another improvement is Sears is using local repair businesses which makes service time more convenient and faster for all. Much better!

name: Glen Zachreson
text: Received a completed status email on a work order which was not fixed. Need more detail information to the reason why the work order was closed. Unable to get the status online.

name: charlie whatley
text: Sears repair came out as scheduled, diagnosed the unit not cooling properly both freezer and refrigerator. Technician was very knowledgeable and professional. Job was completed by servicing the compressor and recharging and checking for leaks. Paid the service fee of about $145. The freezer came to life and is freezing but the refrigeration dept. only gets down ranging from 44-55 degrees. We are very disappointed as we installed a new compressor via Sears Appliance Repair in October of 2019. The most recent tech did not check any other components except the compressor. Any possibility of a tech coming out to check other components of our unit? Another disappointed customer!!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to bring this to our attention, charlie. We hate to see that you have had this kind of experience and would love the opportunity to take a look to see how we can help out. If you would please email the name, address, and phone number that is associated with the service order to our Sears Home Services Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/SearsHomeServices/, we will be able to see how we can help out. We appreciate your business and look forward to assisting you with this matter.

name: Sheree “Gigi” Thornton
text: The Mechanic was very personable and knowledgeable and had us up and running again in no time. My only complaint was it took so long to get an appointment...almost 2 weeks out from the day I called. Other than that, I was very pleased with the actual work and the mechanic who performed it.

name: Bara Designs
text: I have maintained a Sears Home Warranty on a few of my appliances for several years now, and I can truly say that it has more than paid for itself!  Unfortunately they just don't make things like they used too!  The folks that work for Sears are professional, courteous, thorough, and prompt!  Recently when my refridgerator was accumulating condensation and causing the metal shelving brackets to rust, they first told me that rust was not covered, however after further investigating they discovered the insulation had failed and are providing me with a full replacement!  I highly recommend Sears and their home maintenance agreements.

name: Nancy Reba
text: Courteous and efficient.  Will only buy appliances, etc. at Sears because of the wonderful service.

name: Sarah Creech
text: Sears Buyer Beware:  I am a senior and have been a loyal Sears’s customer for over 50 years but am very sad to say, I will never utilize Sears products or their service ever again and I will warn everyone I know to beware.   Sears furnished my homes in Chicago, Bethlehem, PA and in Montgomery, AL.  Sears has been my standby for over 50 years and it was an institution I really believed in.   The horrible, inexcusable way I have been treated by Sears in Daphne, AL for the past two months is unforgivable. I was told that I would be receiving a refund from 4 different Sears’s people.  I called Sears each time check was promised and not received.  I was told that confirmation would be sent via email very shortly.  Emails never came.   The fourth time (after 2 months) the Sears person I called said they had decided not to give me a refund.  So, I am going to the Better Business Bureau.  Sears may be going out of business, but they could hurt a lot of people in the meantime.  It took almost two months of contacting Sears Customer Service before I got to this point.   My dryer was old, and the refund promised wasn’t that much.   My refund is no longer the point.  After reading all of the numerous complaints by Sears customers, in addition to what I experienced first-hand, something needs to be done to protect others.

name: Keith & Suzanne Douglas
text:
Washing Machine still don't work since May 20, 2017 started pursuing Repairs.
It is now July 24, 2017
I purchased protection agreement in good faith.
They offered me $50.00 rewards.
That is not the equivalent to purchase price of washing machine or purchase agreement plan.
I only want it to work or a replacement washing machine that works.
It worked a little before service took place just made a loud noise.

name: Nelson Russell
text:
My complaint is not with the workmanship.  The technician was very professional and proficient; however, when he tech arrived, I was advised that some parts were not covered by the maintenance agreement.  I should have been told this on the first trip when the grill was inspected and the parts were ordered.  Cost was reasonable, but totally unexpected.
While we're at it, I also had a maintenance agreement on some yard equipment, but did not renew because I now have to drive 50 miles to take them to an authorized sears repair shop.  You would think that in a city the size of Mobile AL that Sears would have a local repair facility.  The days of getting service from companies who appreciate the customer is over.  Sad state of affairs.

name: Clay Davidson
text:
Technician was pleasant and fixed my fridge without any issues. His performance is the direct reason I purchased a home warranty from sears.

Good experience. Definitely recommend.

name: Renee Jones
text:
Refrigerator not working since 1/28. We had to throw all our food out. Customer service scheduled an appointment for  today 8 am - 12 pm.
Appliance repair company that handles repairs for Sears rescheduled our appointment for  Friday morning.  They dont do repairs in Georgia on Tuesday,  only Alabama. Sears assured us they were coming out. They NEVER came. Called customer service,  call went to the Philippines! They were NO help at all! Dont waste your money on the Master Protection Plan. It gets you promises of food reimbursement IF the technician says the there is no way the food would have been edible if we left it in there.
The entire refrigerator is HOT on the inside like it's not  plugged up.  Dont ask for a Supervisor to call either. They won't.  Never buying anything from them again.

name: amlight1
text: Serviceman thought on a previous call that the temperature sensors needed to be replaced. He ordered 2. Said that when he came back he would olhm them to make sure they were accurate.  When he came back he immediately open the packages and asked me to disconnect the power to the oven. I did and he immediately replace the sensors not checking them for accuracy. Within 10 minutes he told me to turn the power back on. Packed up his tools and said that should take care of it. I ask him if he was not going to put his temperature sensor in and check the temperature and this was his answer. " well you will just have to cook in it" and left.  Problem was not solved,  the oven was still cooking at 60° hotter than the temperature setting.

name: Sonny Weeks
text: Following two repairmen visits to my home to repair an ice maker in my Kenmore refrigerator, my ice maker is still not working. I am now waiting almost one month for another appointment to have someone come out to my home for the third time.  At this time my experience with Sears repair is very poor.  I am very disappointed in my experience and do not see customer service as a tool that Sears repair service can advertise.  When my appointment is given, each time I am told they will be at my home between 8 am and 5 pm.  For a family where everyone works, this is certainly not convenient.  If my ice maker had been repaired this may have been more tolerable.  I was told by the last rep that the 90 day repair guarantee began at the time of the first repair appointment. That just adds fat to the fire in my lack of confidence in your services.

name: Sharon McCaskill
text:
My ice maker was not fixed.  This was the 5th time we have called fro repair on it and it is not ever fixed. Still leaking water from the ice dispenser down the front of the fridge

Another service man came out this week and caulked the ice maker again.  It is still leaking from the ice maker inside the refridgerater and probably will begin leaking again from the dispenser again. NOT FIXED ...AGAIN.  IT SEEMS THEY CAN'T FIX IT.

Again my ice maker and dispenser are leaking about 1/4 cup each time I get ice and it is leaking and forming ice cycles from outside the ice bucket. Still the same. It is sad to have to go through this when you need your refrigerator repaired especially when it began when you got it home and as much as the price was that I paid!

Still leaking again.  The last repair man installed a new fan or did something to the fan. It helped a short while. Then started again.  This time the repair man did something else in the ice compartment.  It is better for now but just waiting to see if it fixed it this time.  We will see.

Sears needs to  get rid of the outsourced customer service in the third world countries--- they simply  do not care( sears must not either) and are completely  incompetent !!!!!

text: The technician arrived over an hour past the scheduled time and had not advised me of the expected delay until over 30 minutes past the arrival window. More importantly, the dryer was not fixed properly. The replaced belt came off when attempting to dry the first load. I contacted the technician immediately, but he refused to return. I was required to schedule another appointment through Sears - first available 6 days later- and learned that he actually had assumed the first repair would probably not hold. He was also late for this appointment but did contact me just shortly past the window for arrival. It was properly repaired this time, but I found the exhaust vent hose no longer attached securely. A voicemail message to him within 15 minutes of his leaving was ignored and I finally had to have someone else repair it. This was a very unpleasant repair experience!

name: Shari Smith
text: Our company, the National Service Cooperative, has worked with Jones McLeod for over 25 years.  They represent our organization in all of Alabama.  The reason that they are the Premier Service Provider for us is because of their commitment to excellence and to customer service.  With ever service call they perform, they send trained technicians with the parts needed to complete the repairs.  Their management team, led by Chris McLeod, is the best there is.  You are in the best hands when you select Jones McLeod!!

resp.text: Shari, Jones-McLeod is so thankful to have worked with the National Service Cooperative for all those years. Jones-McLeod loves taking care of all your commercial appliance service needs, whether it is in a restaurant, school, church, hospital, or any other facility with a commercial kitchen. So thankful for our partnership!

name: jessica Chen
text:
We had service with them several times, they were wonderful but last time they came couldn’t found what is problem with fryer and fryer just back working normal when they come so they just left doesn’t charge anything, I was appreciate they came even they didn’t do anything. But today my fryer don’t work again, I called up there and ask for service, they just told me can’t do any service for us no more, I asked why is there any reason to make y’all to do this to me? They just kept saying sorry we can’t do any service for you no more. I don’t really understand so I questioning him why? He told me he don’t want to argue with me, just they don’t service us no more. Wow..

That’s ridiculous. First, we never yelled out anybody . Second we gave you guys credit card info to trust you guys to charge us for service. Third the last time service which is couple days ago he couldn’t find the problem for the fryer So I asked him before he leave what if the fryer stop working again, he told me just call office for service. Then I ask him how about the charge? He answered he will not charge me this time but he doesn’t know if his boss going to charge or not. So I will just say thanks to him because I knew there is a fee for came out.  But I don’t think I will have a problem with you guys to collet the bills. You might need to talk to who came for the service first. Maybe they were lying for some reason.

resp.text: Mr. Chen, as we explained we can no longer render you service due to the fact that on multiple visits to your establishment we have had a difficult time getting paid for our services and our technicians and dispatchers have been yelled out on each occasion. text: Great service from this group.  The lady on the phone helped me figure out a glitch that was saying my appliance that was purchased two weeks prior was out of warranty. Had to call GE and fix the error. Then they sent someone out in just a few days to find out why my washing machine part of my washer dryer combo was not working. The person named Shawn was super nice.  My husband offered to help move the appliance out from the wall, he had previous neck surgery. Shawn quickly said NO, you sit down I will move it out.  Thank goodness, I wouldn't want to hear about my husbands neck for the next week.  : )    He found the problem right away.  We had a washer in this cattery building before and only used cold water. We had a fire and built a new building. When the carpenter put the new lines in, my husband told him to only hook up cold water. Well that was the problem, these newfangled washers have sensors, and the sensor on the hot side said there was no water coming in at all.  Shawn stayed around until the washer ran through the full cycle to make sure that was the only problem. He didn't say we needed a relay, a new motor, a new anything.  All we needed was the lever switched on on the hot water line.    He was super nice, courteous and I would recommend this company for any appliance service you need...We will certainly put them in our speed dial!       Mitzi and David Guess, Stevenson Alabama.

text: I contacted this company in February to fix our viking oven that had one delayed ignition that scared me a bit and I wanted that to never happen again, but was still working the day they arrived. This was confirmed during their diagnosis when it was working fine, but they recommended changing a few parts that seemed worn.  After 3 months, 4 visits and over a thousand dollars wasted they have left the oven worse off than they found it and it does not work at all anymore. The technician insisted on calling me "young lady" which I found very patronizing. After this last round they said we needed over $700 in more parts and I called back 30 minutes later after I spoke with my husband to confirm they could order them. I called back today 3 weeks later to check in and they claim they never got the call and they hadn't ordered them. Even if this was a human error someone should have contacted me to check in on my decision before 3 weeks had gone by and I had to check for myself. They have also never been able to fully explain why my oven worked before the parts were switched and then stopped working after.

name: Blake Roberson
text:
This company did warranty repair on a window air conditioner unit for me. The GE unit broke down 1 month before the 1 year warranty expired. Doctor Appliance came out, took the unit, worked on it, and then returned it. It worked ok when they returned it. It was working when they left. This was in late summer, so I only used the air conditioning for a month. This spring I started it up and it isn't cooling! The repair only came with a 90 day guarantee. So, I called them. It is going to cost me $120 bucks just to get them to come look at it, even though their repair was likely not done correctly, (the unit most likely was not functioning during the 90 day warranty, it just wasn't being used in the winter months). Long story I know.
I'm also extremely ticked off with GE. I now have a $500 unit that will heat but not cool. None of our local HVAC people will even come look at it. They say a window unit is just a throw away. I don't have $500 to just throw away! CUSTOMER SERVICE IS DEAD, A THING OF THE PAST.

resp.text:
Blake,

I am sorry that you are dissatisfied with our service. I will advise you that your unit was actually warrantied by the manufacturer not us. The manufacturer provides a 90 day warranty on all repairs any company performs regardless to whom performs the repair. Our warranty is slightly different and had the unit not been covered by the manufacturer things perhaps could have been different or at least there could have been more wiggle room.

I completely understand that you may not have used the unit for cooling in the winter. Unfortunately the manufacturers have no way of knowing when a consumer starts to use their unit and it is not up to us to make that decision. We have a contract with them that dictates what we can and can not do. Every step of the process starting from the first visit up to the final repair are documented. In fact we require prior approval from them before we can even put a single part on a unit. The manufacturer will perform a cost to replacement analysis to determine if it is a repair that they deem is worth pursuing.

I strongly suggest you call them and ask them to take care of the issue. I see them offer concessions on warranties all of the time. Especially in a situation like this. I have no issues with being an advocate for you in this matter. Should the need arise, you can direct them to speak with me personally.

Given your distance from us, we would have to charge a service call if the manufacturer is unwilling to cover the repair. Alternatively, you could bring the unit to us which would greatly lower the service call rate and you would only be responsible for the diagnostic.

Please let me know if there is anything else I can do to help you in this regard. Should they choose to send us a work order we would be more than pleased to come and help you. We want you to be happy with your product.

Please feel free to call and talk with me about this During business hours should you feel that I have left out any pertinent information. My name is Jonathan.

Kind regards,

Jonathan

He responded expeditiously, placed the order for us and we now have a working microwave. Shayna kept me apprised of the status and contacted me when there was an earlier opening. It was most definitely a pleasurable experience. I highly recommend Doctor Appliance for any of your  appliance repair needs from dispatch (Shayna) to the repair technician (Jonathan) -- they are proficient and professional. Be sure to ask for Jonathan!!

name: Daniel Bell
text: Excellent communication and customer service. The repair technician was on time, very knowledgeable, and able to promptly fix my refrigerator issue. I will definitely be using their services for any future appliance repair needs.

name: LeRoy Stricklin
text: Excellent technician Johnathon. Arrived on time completing his work very professionally. I recommend Doctor Appliance to resolve all your appliances repair needs

name: Bobby Clark
text: Great company! LG linear compressor failed after 15 months. Lg sent these guys for warranty replacement as the warranty has been extended to cover 5 years labor and 10 years on the compressor. Doctor Appliance showed up on time and the technician was very knowledgeable and fast. He got the compressor done in about a hour and 1/2. The call center was courteous and kept me in the loop the whole time. Took about a week from start to finish. Thanks Doctor Appliance for the great work  and LG for standing behind your products and making things right on a known failure!!!

name: Jody Radley
text: WOW!  Excellent customer service, the serviceman not only fixed my stove, but cleaned up everything around it. I appreciated the little extras they provided. I will be telling all my friends about Doctor Appliance. Great friendly service.

name: Richard Knight
text: Incredibly good service in performing warranty service on our 2 year old LG French door fridge.  It was a major compressor repair & he did in just under 2 hours.  Technician was very competent & experienced.  It took 3 business days from getting the work order from LG to completing repair.  The dispatcher is very customer satisfaction oriented & called us promptly to both schedule the repair & let us know the technician was on the way.   The technician was extremely knowledgeable & friendly.  This is a top of line appliance repair business.  Can’t get it enough stars.

name: William Healy
text: Outstanding service, I would definitely recommend Doctor Appliance. Kendal gave me a heads up call as to his arrival, explained everything, was swift and very experienced, was very neat and organized, would have him back again for any appliance repair.

name: Al Beightol
text:
Honest on time communication, coupled with expert on time service. I would be foolish to
even consider calling anyone else for appliance service
Thank you Dr Appliance

name: Bob & Roxy Birkmaier
text: Great customer service from Shana and Jonathan.  Both were courteous, professional and represented Doctor Appliance well.  Jonathan's experience was evident in his repair and explaining the process in layman's terms.

name: Irene Lynn
text: giving a shout out to Doctor Appliance for the great customer service we received when our LG refrigerator was having some issues with the black stainless steel peeling off ...Thank you so much for replacing the doors....

name: Nancy Moore
text: The gentleman who came here was professional and very helpful.  I will definitely call again if I need any repairs of my appliances.  Was a pleasure to deal with him and was told if I have any questions, to call and he would be glad to speak with me.

name: Emily Jackson
text: Great experience!  I appreciate the prompt communication with the office, the technician was knowledgeable, arrived timely, and completed work efficiently. Will definitely use again!

name: Tony Monks
text: Excellent service. Went the extra mile finding the problem after another two companies couldn't. Thanks!

name: Cheri Randall
text: Great technician. Highly recommend.

name: shana porter
text: From the first call we made to them starting with Shana to Jonathan  coming out and fixing our fridge and ordering our parts , very professional very nice. Would use them them again and would recommend them to anyone.

name: Amy Colvin
text: fGreat and friendly service.

name: Lillian Guffey
text: Kendal was very nice, efficient and able to answer all our questions.

name: James Clark
text: he did  a great job.would use again.

name: Don Evans
text: The Tech came on time and was friendly, professional and Skilled in his knowledge of the problem, the service was completed quickly. I am very pleased with how the service call was performed.

name: Cam Sumner
text: Very professional. Quickly repaired refrigerator with minimal interruption.

name: Michelle Ullman
text: They are all friendly and keep you informed. Jonathon was quick at deciphering the issue, and he even asked for a broom to clean up, awesome!!!

name: TJ Peck
text: Technician was incredibly friendly and helpful in resolving our dishwasher issue.

name: Jennifer Henderson
text: They are the best!   Very informative too!

name: Tyler Malone
text: Doctor Appliance has fantastic service! We've had a problematic refrigerator on which Jonathan has replaced a couple of parts or performed maintenance. I've been extremely pleased with his ability to explain the problem and the work he has performed. Including the background on why our particular refrigerator model had a history of problems. Very knowledgable and always very personable, too.

name: Adam Stapleton
text: The service technician did a great job and Doctor Appliance will be the only company we will use for all of our appliance needs!!

name: Jason Wimsett
text: Alsome job.He came in my refrigerator was making the noise I called about( crickets ). Right then knew the problem( low coolant ).He check everything to make sure and replace the compressor.Also ask him question about the appliances I have and was able to help me out .Thank you

name: Philip Bowles
text: Great. Kendall did great . In and out. Will use again. Recommend others do the same.

name: terry sanders
text: They came out to repair a drier and after pulling it away from the wall and “fixing it” they informed my wife that they couldn’t put the drier back against the wall because they would have to move the washer to hook the vent hose back up. He wasn’t allowed to touch the washer.  I travel on business so that left my wife with four kids at home with no drier after it was “fixed”.  He said the drier vent was supposed to be 4’, and didn’t offer to place the proper vent hose on which we would have paid for.  All the tech was worried about was leaving, and BTW the drier is still making the same noise he supposedly fixed.  No concern for the customer more concerned about finishing his route, you are just a number to this company you would be better off finding a another company than these guys.

resp.text:
Good afternoon Terry and thank your post. The manufacturer of your unit contacted us to take a look at the unit and diagnose the issue. The issue is your side wall on the right hand side is slightly pushed in causing the unit to chatter against the steam line internal to the unit. Your wife was shown the issue. This unit is under warranty and thus we did not charge you for any work performed. In addition we advised your spouse as to the installation related issues in your current set up. I understand your frustration being that you were not home and we wish we could have related it to you directly.

When asked, your wife said she could have you replace the venting. Due to this being a warranty claim, installation issues can not be covered by the manufacturer. Had your wife requested, we could have charged you separately and addressed your install problem. She did not request this and stated that you would take care of it.

We try our hardest to inform our customers as to what their appliance manufacturer will and will not cover and are truly sorry if any of it was lost in communication.  Should you like to discuss this matter further, I implore you to give us a call. Please ask to speak with me “Jonathan directly”

Thank you for your time and take care.

name: Steve Jenks
text: Great  work. Very professional.  Explained everything that was done. A+++++. Great job.

name: Brent Noll
text:
Liars and obviously under qualified. "Johnathon" or whatever his name is would rather make excuses as to why he can't fix something than to actually try to order a part he doesn't have. There are much better qualified repair companies out there.
Avoid this business at all cost, they will make you wish you had!

resp.text:
Mr. Noll, can you please call our offices as soon as possible to discuss this  matter. We are located in Winchester TN and I could not find any customers in our records listed under your name. I would very much like to find out which one of our technicians was in your home. It is very important to us to make things right. You can reach us at 931-313-9083.

Is there a chance you have our business confused with another establishment with a similar name? I personally would greatly appreciate it if you called us as soon as possible. You may also reach us directly via email at service@docappliance.com

To show you how important this is to us, we are willing to come out to your location with no service call charge and take a look at what "another company" could not fix. We are contracted with most of the Major appliance manufacturers and unless a part has been discontinued we typically get it shipped to us. We would love to gain you as a customer and restore your faith in this industry!

name: Krissa Barnum
text: We bought a used washer and dryer and called doctor appliance to come out and take a look at it. They were very polite and reassuring that my units work great .. Highly Recommended !!

name: Lisa Greenwood
text: Called and a man came out. My dryer was giving me trouble. After looking  it over the man said no problem, I believe I have this part in my van. With a short reasonable amount of time he had it up and running again. Thank you so much.

name: chris maye
text: THEY DID WHAT THEY SAID THEY WOULD DO AND WERE EASY TO TALK TO WITH MY PROBLEM

name: Pamela Gregory
text: Great job , very friendly and respectful people I will definitely be using them from now on for all repairs . Thanks .

name: Pipoo S
text: Amazing service very fast thank you so much love you

name: Shayna Leibovitch
text: Amazing service. Their techs make sure the customer understands everything that is going on and are highly knowlegable. The fast turnaround time is fantastic. Nobody wants to wait for days without a stove or fridge.

name: john bufe
text: Top notch!  Replaced my microwave door handle that was broken.  After many attempts of gluing the handle back together I finally decided to replace it.  I called several local parts repair companies and the quotes that I received were more than the microwave was probably worth.  I happened upon Doctor Appliance and gave them a call.  Best decision ever, they were knowledgeable, friendly and were able to order the part and mail it to me.  Once I received the part they were able to walk me through the installation. I would highly recommend!

name: Teresa Safer
text: Great service!

name: Keven Vegas
text: I called these guys out last September when my Freezer stopped cooling. Turns out it was the compressor. They looked up my information and were able to submit the work as a warranty repair even when I didnt buy it from them. It didnt cost me a penny. I am very happy with their work and will continue to use them for all of my appliance needs.

resp.text: Keven, thank you for your kind comments. We try our hardest to make every customers experience the best possible. We are grateful for your positive feedback.

name: Noah Sidel
text: We needed some help with a couple of broken knobs on our stove and Doctor Appliance stepped up and not only shipped us new knobs, but also walked us through the installation. Excellent service!

resp.text:
Noah,

Thank you for the positive review. We try each and every day to make every customers experience a special one.

name: Jonathan Leibovitch
text: Amazing service at an affordable rate. Call them and you will not be disappointed.

name: Lynn Williams
text: Very nice and efficient service!  Thank you

name: Khryss Campos
text: I am glad LG partnered me with Doctor Appliance for the repair of my refrigerator under warranty.  During our initial call (spoke with Shana), they had already given me a date for the repair but when the parts came early, they called me again to have the repair done earlier.  On repair day, Jonathan called to say he was on his way and was about 15 minutes away.  He did the repair and I had a working refrigerator after 1.5 hours!  Thank you!!

name: Samantha Quinn
text: Great company, really professional, washing machine works great.

name: Garvintncom Nashville
text: I know and trust them enough I send all of my clients to them

name: Michael Warren
text: Kendal was great

name: Andrea Word
text: Punctual, efficient, and effective.

name: Diane Dowden
text: He was fast, and experienced

name: Amber Adams
text: I use to work for Bienville and I had stopped by. Wonderful place to work

name: Cori Goddard
text: Horrible company. Absolutely no customer service. I called 4 days in a row, sent an email and Will not communicate with American Home Sheild. “Pearl Ann”was the only person I could speak to and she blamed the technician for not notating correctly and that she couldn’t help me, she was the rudest person I’ve ever spoke to in customer service. (They say it’s repairable but the technician said it caught fire and was unsafe). They need to not falsify documents and learn how to talk to customers. I understand this is a family business and you do what you want essentially but don’t hang up on someone when they ask for help. Took 3 months and still no resolution. Just like all the other negative comments, do not let your warranty company send them out!

name: Reino Fritz
text: Washing machine agitator went out and tech came out to fix it. In the progress he blew up the control board. Its been over a month and still waiting on then. They never call with updates. I have to call everytime to see what is going on with the case and they keep you on hold forever. Worst place.

name: Rachel Johnston
text: HORRIBLE !!! THE WORST! I have never taken the time to complain online about a company. That is how bad they are. I have been waiting on a warranty refrigerator repair for 6 weeks. They canceled the first appointment. Then closed my request. After 2 weeks of waiting on hold, emailing, putting a request on their website I finally was able to get a hold of someone. They rescheduled 2 weeks out!! The technician showed up but left because he said he didn't have a gate code. After waiting 6 weeks!! I still can not get ahold of anyone to get my refrigerator fixed. I have lost 2 full stock of food waiting on them. I've paid a repair man 3 time to temp defrost fridge waiting on repair. This is the worst experience I have ever had with a service company. They will never answer their phone. !!

name: Mary Carroll Finley
text: TERRIBLE! Truly the worst company. Our Kitchenaid refrigerator stopped cooling. With it still under warranty, we had to UNFORTUNATELY rely on S & S. They sent someone to tell us what we already knew...that it wasn't cooling and that parts had to be ordered. WEEKS later the part is "in" and we were scheduled to have repaired today. My husband even went by yesterday to confirm. We were told once again that the part was in and that they would be here this morning between 8AM-12PM. Guess what? The part is now MISSING! Our appointment is cancelled and part has to be ordered again. We are now almost 2 months without a refrigerator with no end in sight. No one there cares. Not their problem. They don't answer the phone either so don't even waste your time on that. Truly mind blowing.

name: Randy Buckner
text: I scheduled a service appointment on-line, through the Maytag Service center. I selected the first available date from the calendar provided. 10 days later on the scheduled and accepted date for the repair i was notified that they were overbooked and could not come out for another 10 days.  When I called Maytag they conformed that the appointment was accepted by S & S and a technician was assigned.  when I called S & S to discuss this the service agent got defensive and stated that there were many others who have been waiting for months for parts and that I had NO RIGHT to cut the line!!!!  After I asked to speak with someone above him he said that he would forward my info to management and HUNG UP on me! This is the worst service group I have ever seen!  I called MAYTAG back and found another Maytag service company to come and service my machine.

name: Darryl Lee
text: I scheduled this company to come look at my refrigerator at the advice of another company since they handled the warranty work for Kitchen Aid. My refrigerator stopped cooling and the freezer stopped working. I was unable to reach the company on the phone and did not get a callback from the message I left, so I scheduled an appointment online. This was on 11/30/20. Tech came out on 12/4/20 and determined that the compressor was bad and needed to be replaced. they had to order parts. After finally getting the parts, a different tech came out on 1/20/21. He said the compressor was working and some boards needed to be replaced. Again, parts had to be ordered. A while after the expected parts delivery date, I called for an update and was told the parts were in.  An appointment was scheduled for the following week on 3/1/21. On the morning of the appointment, the tech called me and said that the parts were not in and cancelled the appointment. At this point, I was livid and called Kitchen Aid directly to complain. They called S&S and basically were told that the parts were never ordered. So again, I had to wait for parts. On 4/2/21, I received an email that the parts were in and a link to schedule an appointment. I tried calling, but again, got no one and I left a message. I never received a call back. I tried again the following day, but still could not get anyone on the phone. I went ahead and scheduled an appointment for 4/15/21. On 4/15, my appointment was scheduled between 8-12. when it got to be almost 12, I called and actually got a person on the phone. They told me that they were overbooked and someone was supposed to call me and tell me that my appointment had been cancelled. I wanted to reach through the phone and rip someone's head off!!!!! They rescheduled me for today, 4/16/21. Tech came out and replaced the boards and said that the compressor was not coming on. Now I have to wait for a compressor to be ordered AGAIN!!!! I was given an appointment date of 4/26/21 and that's if the parts comes in, which I'm not counting on . By then it will have been almost five months that I've had to be without my refrigerator. This company seems to handle a lot of warranty work and if you have to use them, I hope this will let you know what you're getting into. If you don't have to use them.....RUN AWAY!!!!!!

name: Charli Hamlin
text: This was the second time we’ve used S & S for a kitchen appliance repair (last year was the dishwasher), and we’ve had wonderful experiences both times. Brandon was so kind, called ahead to work out a time to come, then called again closer to that time to confirm. He was super knowledgeable, neat, tidy, very pleasant and professional, and worked efficiently. We will always use S & S and request him as our technician again! Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for the review and the feedback Charli! Brandon is a great guy and a great tech and we'll be happy to send him back next time you need us (hopefully it's not too soon ☺)

name: James Scarbrough
text: I have called this company 3 days in a row now and they do not answer their phone nor will they call me back. I've listened to the on hold music now for over 3 hours this week. I've left messages and still no call back. I am supposed to have a technician come out today to repair my fridge today, 5/28/21. No one has called me or emailed me to confirm my appointment. So imagine they're not coming today and I'll have to wait another month for the the next appointment. It has been 4 months and my refrigerator, which is under warranty, has not been fixed! I will call Whirlpool and request a different service company. I would never recommend this company. Communication is key!

name: Greg Gouge
text: Fast, friendly service.  Technician was both professional and personable.  Recommended for all your appliance repairs.

name: Brandon Matthews
text:
S&S came to repair my fridge that was making a weird noise and not making ice properly. The tech asked some great questions on the phone to better prepare himself for when he arrived on site. He also called with a 30 minute heads up that he was on his way, which I greatly appreciated.

The tech was knowledgable, friendly, and went above and beyond for me. He was even going to put everything back into the freezer and fridge when he was done. I assured him that was more than necessary and I would take care of it.

The fridge ultimately has to be replaced, but the tech did all he could to leave it as good as possible so I can have more time to shop.

Overall I was pleased with my experience and will definately call S&S again in the future.

name: Katheleen Garanzuay
text: It was a bad experience the guy you sent out here didn't do anything but stand around and argued with me when I was trying to tell him what was wrong with the refrigerator he refused to look at it so I told him to leave and I contacted rentacenter and told them to find someone else I didn't appreciate his addittude very rude and very uninterested in the job at hand

name: Tina Hart
text:
Read everyone's reviews from the past two months from lack of communication and just not getting the job done. I had the exact same experience. I do not recommend and will never use. American home shield needs to outsource to another company.

UPDATE!!!
Instead of being sorry that I had a poor experience, do your job and fix my oven. : )

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback Ms. Hart. I'm sorry to hear that you felt your experience was not a good one. We did reach out multiple times to get you scheduled after getting the part in with no response, and when we did speak to you and come to your home, he replaced the malfunctioning part in your oven and confirmed it was working as it should.

name: Adam West
text: I cannot speak more highly of S&S Appliance. The team is always extremely professional, knowledgable, and strives to ensure their customers are happy. I understand that this is something which comes from the top and filters into their staff. These type of emergencies are not always a quick or even an easy fix but the team works hard to make sure the issue is fixed quickly. Things break, things stop working, and we appreciate how the team works to make sure those items that make our daily lives easier, working again.

resp.text: Thanks you the review and the feedback Adam! We know how frustrating it can be when an essential appliance in your house goes down and we always want to get the customer back up and going as quickly as possible. Glad we were able to get you taken care of and hope you'll think of us next time you're in need of a repair.

name: Keisha Torres
text:
Customer Beware:

This has been the most unprofessional and frustrating company that I have ever had to work with.
