Had I not been home, in all likelihood, we would have had a house fire.  I tried to call him back on his cell and he didn't answer and the company had closed and doesn't have an after hours/emergency number (it was a Saturday when they came and they must close at noon).  DON'T use this company or if you do, make sure you are home the rest of the day in case something like this happens to you.

The home warranty dispatched a different company after I let the have it and the second guy found the problem-when the stove flipped the breaker and blew sparks everywhere, apparently it fused part of the circuit board so the warming drawer was on-and on high-all the time.  The guy from S and S didn't even look at the circuit boards and didn't stick around long enough to tell there was a problem.

name: Myron Dawson
text: Didn't have what i needed.but told me where to get it

resp.text: Myron, thanks for the review! Hate that we didn't have the part for you but glad we were able to point you in the right direction.

name: J Doss
text: Would be nice if the people you talk to give you enough time to find the information that they say they need before hanging up in your face. If it's that serious and you guys are in THAT big of a hurry, then I will take my business elsewhere!

name: Stephanie Burgin
text: We had a few things that needed fixed, and Ray was the one to do the job. Very professional, polite, and knew exactly what he was doing.  Thank you again Ray!!

name: Will Rainey
text: Very rude, down talking to customers and not interested in customer service.

name: Carl Lane
text: Axxton Southwick was our service technician yesterday to repair our Whirlpool refrigerator.  Not only did he fit us in several days early but he did a great job.  He was very courteous and professional.

name: William Syphurs
text: I have used this company on several different occasions to buy parts. They are very knowledgeable and have the parts I have needed on hand. I highly recommend S & S!

name: Jan Hajek
text: Ray Crawford serviced my washing machine today. He did a fantastic job. Thank you

name: Aliesha Hansen
text: Pleased with S & S scheduling and service for our washer repair! After a horrible experience with Maytag repair service through Sears (no-show technician after I waited 2 wks!), I called S & S. The scheduling process was straightforward, and technician arrived when promised. He was courteous and diagnosed the problem. A part had to be ordered which meant the technician had to come a second time to install the part. Again, he arrived when promised and only took 10–15 minutes to install the new part. I had a very good experience and would recommend S & S!

name: cheryl washington
text: Ray was a very good technician.He was very helpful and knowledgeable about the product.I  will recommend S&S to all my family and friends

name: Fran Hornsby
text: Ray came out to fix my dryer. He was very prompt, did an excellent job diagnosing and fixing the problem and also gave me some helpful information about the use of my washer and dryer.

name: Allen Koch
text: Chris was the tech that came to our home to fix our washing machine and he  did a great job and very friendly.

name: Lisa Woods
text:
Ray was my Service Technician , he was very knowledgeable  &  courteous ,
&  always on time for my appointment,
Repairs were done fast , I will always use S&S in the future, & I recommend you to ask for Ray.

name: Megan Schrimsher
text: Ray Crawford was on time, communicated the issue in a way that was understandable, and went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. Highly recommend!!

name: austinpt100
text: Where do i start? With the incompetence or stupidity? I don't recommend this licensed level of incompetence to anyone!! So save yourself the frustration and don't use them my home owners warranty service sent them to my home, USELESS!!!

name: Rosemary Range
text:
I BOUGHT A KITCHEN MAID REFRIGERATOR IN JUNE AND IT DID NOT WORK PROPERLY SINCE I BOUGHT IT ...….WITH TWO REPAIR PERSONS COMING AT DIFFERENT TIMES.

THIS THIRD TECH WAS TOTALLY PROFESSIONAL, KNEW HOW TO REPAIR AND VISUALLY DIAGNOSE AS WELL AS HANDS ON.

RICK BOCK IS THE BEST.  THE CONTINUOUS WHINING BECAUSE OF THE WRONG SIGNAL, INDICATING THAT THE DOOR WAS OPEN; ONLY BECAUSE WHEN IT WAS CONSTRUCTED, THEY LEFT IT UNLEVEL.

NOW....NO NOISE, LIGHTS ON AND HOPEFULLY ICE SOON.  THANK YOU RICK BOCK, THEY NEED 20 MORE LIKE YOU!!!  BLESSINGS

name: bekah morrow
text: Ray was kind, quick and he had great helpful hints for cleaning and maintaining our oven.

name: Amanda Osborn
text: My 9 month old washer messed up & this was the company Whirlpool was sending to repair it. I will admit that after reading the reviews I was quiet hesitant to use them. They called & sent an email confirming the date & time of the service. The technician, Mike, called when he was an hour out to let me know he was on his way. He was very courteous, explained the problem & reassured it was definitely a manufacturer error & not a user error, & rescheduled me for a week later to repair it. The following week I again got an email & automated call the day before, & Mike called that morning to let me know he was on his way. After an hour of working on my washer it is now good as new, & I am very thankful for Mike & his services! After several bad encounters with faulty appliances & mediocre repair services, it was a relief to have someone who wanted to do their job & make a costumer happy!

name: Will Watkins
text: I had an appointment with this company but they failed to show up nor did they call. When I called them regarding the issue, the lady put me on hold for over 30mins and never returned to the line. Very unprofessional.

name: Colby Sims
text: I normally don’t leave reviews but Kayla Norris in customer service needs to be recognized with five stars!

name: Carl Mansell
text: Rick, the technician identified and corrected the problem with our dryer.  He did not have to spend hours to identify the problem.   We would definitely recommend S&S Appliance, Parts and Service.

name: Jenny Brown
text: Tech Ray Crawford was very helpful and resolved my issue quickly and professionally.

name: Roscoe
text: Whirlpool sent S&S out for a refrigerator repair.  Tech arrived on time, diagnosed the problem and ordered the parts.  Refrigerator had to thaw out first. Kent was the tech.  Repair done very fast and he answered all my questions. Communication was excellent with S&S.  I would not hesitate to use them again. The only con is the $89.95 service call.

name: Matt Johnson
text: All I can say is that Tim Smith is the man!!! Very professional and extremely hard working. He came into the house with a mission to complete the work and didn't miss a beat. He was also very safe in checking to make sure that power was off. I'm very impressed with the work that was performed.

name: Eric
text: Ray was great! Friendly and easy to work with.

name: Kathy Williams
text:
Got an appointment within one day.  Randy Wilson was very friendly and
knowledgeable. I explained the problem.  He knew the answer immediately.
Fixed it fast.  Would use them again and recommend their service.  This
was a Whirlpool washer and dryer.

name: Tom Madonia
text: After about 3 weeks and numerous phone calls to both customer service at Whirlpool and S&S Appliance the repair was completed. There was a lack of communication between Whirlpool and S&S. It shouldn’t take 3 weeks to make a 45 minute repair.

name: chad biernacki
text: 1 Star is way to positive a rating for this place. They were referred  for warranty work. Came out originally and diagnosed the problem. Stated they needed to order parts. They scheduled three or more follow up appts over an almost two month span. Repeatedly said the parts were in would set up a time and date only to say they were on back order. At one point blamed a technician and stated they were no longer working for them.  The last two times two times they set up an appt they again said they had parts even the one on backorder. When it came to day of said the parts they had all along were not there. The final time they called same day as appt and stated a part was damaged. In summary this place is full of excuses. Oh and if you get the female receptionist she isn't a pleasure to deal with.

name: Angela Addison
text: Technician checked my washing machine.  Went out to his truck replaced a part and then when he was finished told me it would need another part.  He told me it would cost more to fix it than replace it.   He then gave me a bill of $211.65.  When, I questioned the cost.  He told me not to worry about it.  It's close to Christmas let your husband fix it.  I let him know, I don't have a husband.  He said my girlfriend could get it then.  He said this as he was going out the door.  The job took less than 30 mins.  I have had other technicians come out.  I have always been given an estimate of how much it would be before any work was done.  When I tried to reach the company.  I got an email back it said sorry for the way you were treated.  They never spoke of why, I was charged for a service that didn't fix my machine and will have to replace it.  I hope no one else has this happen to them.

name: AMARIE W
text:
👎👎👎THEY DESERVE A NEGATIVE 10 👎👎👎
The service repair guy Came out to service my Whirlpool fridge that  wasn’t properly dispensing ice....and ordered the part in October. ( a new left side door)....  he acknowledged that the door was deformed and instead of ordering a NEW fridge he ordered PARTS to replace..In the meantime he use cardboard and tape to produce a makeshift knob for the ice dispenser to connect..He was very rude and told me do not call him and he would only call me when the part is available I may receive it as a Christmas gift but do not continuously call looking for the part it will only prolong the process. I received the part in LATE FEBRUARY!!!!!  I took off work to schedule the appointment for the repair man to arrive he came on the day of the appointment but he did not have the parts to repair the fridge.  He now has to come back for a third time with the part blaming others because he did not deliver the part.  I rescheduled the appointment for the following week. He came with the part this time. The repair guy acknowledged that he’d never serviced my model fridge..saying it would be the first time for both of us.... he replaced the door..... an “easy fix” took 2 1/2 hours... and he did not replace the parts back in the fridge as he’d removed from the old..... He could not remember which wire went to what...  he was so short that I had to give him a chair to stand on to service the fridge...  I tried to explain to him that certain wires did not belong in that area but he was a know it all and put the fridge back together in the way that he wanted...  he then told a family member that was at the home that he could keep the old door at my home to use the door for fishing and to scale fish with the door.  I then asked him to take the door with him because I did not need trash in my home and I am not a hoarder....  he rudely ask my family member if he wanted to keep the door my family said it doesn’t matter to him so the repair guy left the door in my home!!!!!! I tried  explaining to the repair guy that the  door open indicator light should go off instantly when the door is closed.  He continued to work on the light and became very frustrated with me because the indicator light stayed on at least three minutes with the door closed completely..... indicating that the door was still open. I tried to FURTHER explain to the repair guy that  The doors were not aligned properly.  He insisted that the indicator light was to stay on two minutes at most and he was pleased after the light went off and he went home.... I was Livid!!!!!!!!!!  LONG STORY SHORT..... the fridge is now broken!!!! The motor hasn’t turned on I since Monday and the fridge is like a Sona. The ice maker has leaked water all over the floor about 2 weeks after the repair.... the opened door light indicator never worked properly after his repair. and no lights come on other than the interior... and the entire fridge QUIT on Monday....... an 8months NEW fridge...... THANKS REPAIR MAN...... for nothing...!!!!!!!... water on the floor and soaked through floor....... 200 dollars in fresh food RUINED!!!!! After an Escalated complaint to whirlpool they agreed to send out a new unit but it will take three weeks to deliver from the manufacturer.......... I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS COMPANY  you will be better off trying to repair it your self even if you don’t know anything about repairs.......

name: Mitchell West
text: A fellow named Corey Thomas came in and fixed our drier. He identified and fixed the problem quickly and was courteous the entire time he was in my house. Excellent, friendly service. Would happily use this service again.

name: Deb Walton
text: This was the worst customer service ever.  I have a whirlpool refrigerator and the ice dispenser  on the door stopped working.   When I emailed The repair service I told them this first.The repair man they sent did not know how to read his meter because he had it on a.c. not dc current. Then he said I needed a new door completely which would be 474.00. He never ordered the door.  He came back a second time without the door and discovered that there was power in the door, and thought it was the ice maker.  He never ordered that part either.  He told us it would cost over 500.to fix.  It's still not working.  I had no faith that this guy knew what he was doing. HE tried to blame my 75 year old mom for telling him we already replaced the part on our own. Why would I call him if I did that?? Crazy. Then don't get me started on the office staff.  They are rude. Like I asked if I could get my appointment for the morning.   She said I can request it but not guarantee it. I said of course not because we are at your mercy!  If I could give this place a 0 star I would. It sucks DO NOT USE THEM THEY SUCK!

name: Rebekah Weinberger
text: Very helpful and knowledgeable. Were in and out in under 30 minutes!

name: Chelsie Braden
text: This has to be the worst experience I have ever had with a repair company. We bought the extended warranty on our washer and dryer thinking that it was a good idea just in case anything went wrong with them. Well, our washer started giving us a lot of problems and would not stop spinning or drain any water. We called the warranty company and they told us a technician from this company would come out and check our washer. The tech came out and looked at the washer less than 10 minutes and during that time was beyond rude to me. He did not do anything to the washer and just said that he would not be able to come back for another week. He needed to order parts. Well, the day came when someone was supposed to come back to fix our machine and they called us and told us that the repairman called in sick and it would not be til Monday if at all. It is beyond ridiculous what this company has put us through. I would never recommend them to anyone.

name: alex craft
text: Ray did a great, expedient job. Very professional!

name: Howard Dolgoff
text: Axxton is incredible! Fixed my dishwasher flawlessly!

name: James Mulready
text: I bought a new Magtag washer . Found the tub not spinning out water . Lowes sent S&S out to diagnose . Ordered parts, one week later. Part came in they replaced . Machine working like supposed to. Brand new doesnt mean anything . But good service does . S&S did exactly what they said and were very polite.  Hard to find these days . Imagine that someone keeping their promise.  They are great in my eyes

name: Vercingtorix Wilson
text: Knowledgeable staff , prices a little elevated

name: botcwc1
text: Very unorganized. It has been over two months and we still not have not had our appliances fixed. They call and cancel or no-show and then when someone finally shows up has no clue what's going on. Hard to believe that this is the best the Birmingham has to offer I'm sure there are better businesses out there to to send your business too.save the frustration and use a reputable appliance dealer

name: CINDY Sandidge
text: Doug the service technician was a life saver for me. He definitely fixed my washer. I initially had Roberts Appliance sent to my house all they did was clear out some codes and said nothing was wrong. They came back out and have to call technical support amd they were having issues ao the guy left and said he wasnt coming back. But Doug went the extra step and got it fixed for me. I will definitely be recommending this place. Thank you Doug

name: Andrew Kallus
text: Can I give no stars?  Their website says you can schedule a service within two days, it took us weeks before someone was able to come out.  I own a WhirlPool front loading washing machine and the bearing is slowly fading and it makes a lot of noise.  It's loud but it works.  Today, I was told someone will show up between 8am and 12pm.  He did not show up until 2pm.  During the next hour, he disassembled the washing machine.  After about an hour, he told me that headquarters needed him to finish his other jobs, so he left my washing machine disassembled and started his next jobs.  About 530pm he called and said he had one more stop and then will be over.  At 645PM he called again saying he will come back but only to put the washing machine back together.  Around this time I was hungry and went to get food where I noticed he did not turn off the water and it had slowly leaked on the floor.  I cleaned this up and turned off the nozzle.  When he finally returned, he did not clean up any of the water on the floor and started to put the washing machine back together.  Once it was back together, he told me it will work just like it did before where it worked but was noisy.  So once he left, I started a load of wet towels, which I used to clean up the floor.  During the first 30 seconds, while I was gone getting a fan to help dry the floor, I heard what can only be described as a waterfall.  The front of the washing machine was leaking water profusely.  I quickly turned it off. Needless to say that I waited weeks for them to come repair a working washing machine for them to flood my floor and make the washing machine unusable.  Not only that I missed a day of work waiting for 12 hours when if they just did not come it would have been all the same and possibly better.  Throughout this experience, I did not feel like a customer getting any type of good treatment.  He left to do other jobs without even finishing mine and then ends up breaking it.

name: Michelle Fuller
text: Cliff from S&S was very friendly and professional. Highly would recommend.

name: Jameshia Stovall
text:
2/15/2018 they came to my house in Montgomery and when the employee got here. He didn’t even have the part when he got here for my washing machine. Before he left my home he claimed he was going to order the part. And he will return on this Thursday but I was contacted today by the company telling me that the warranty was not approved yet after he had already told me he had ordered the part. Whirlpool needs to revaluate their contract. If my washing machine is not repair by next I will be contacting the attorney Generals office.
AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COST !!! Ridiculous and sad

name: Tim Humphries
text: They’re great with help at the counter, but be warned on the service call!! I had a dryer not heating correctly and while they did fix it, it cost half of what the dryer cost. They will charge a $89 service charge to diagnose the problem. Then you get hit with a $75 labor charge (he was at my house 30-45 minutes) to put a $18 part on. I paid $200 to fix a little bit over $400 dryer. If I’d known ahead of time, I would either called someone else or bought a new one. I should have looked at the reviews first. That should tell you all you need to know.

name: Nina Cobia
text: Wonderful.  The tech had never encountered the problem I was having with the  water dispenser on my refrigerator. He called the factory and the recommended "fix" did not work.  He persevered, called some other techs  and did some trouble shooting until he fixed the problem!  Didn't take long either.  This was after Sears had come out and replaced the water valve which did NOT fix the problem. I called yesterday and he was here today.  It took Sears two weeks.  I would highly recommend. My tech was Doug Raffield and he was professional and friendly.

name: Mal Sinclair
text:
I had an appointment scheduled from 8-12pm today. I called at 12:18 pm to inform them that no one has come by yet. The man that I spoke to told me that the repair man came and waited for ‘15 minutes before leaving a note on my door’. I told him I have not left the house once today, I have been in my living room with my sick toddler. I have a 24 hour Nest video survalliance of my entire street and I can assure you he never even came to my street. He told me I rescheduled your appointment for next week I am sorry we missed you. I said you did not miss me, he is lying to you because I also had a flooring repairman at my house for an hour and a half this morning while my front door was open the entire time and your repairman made no attempt let alone left an alleged note. Instead of trying to resolve the issue he implied I was the liar and not his employee. I would be glad to e mail the video survalliance from 8-12pm!

Update: After filing a BBB complaint I received a reply that the tech did indeed go to the wrong house.

name: D Jackson
text: Doug Raffield came out to service our problem child ice maker!!!! He was great- courteous, prompt, extremely professional, and took great care us. I highly recommend this company and strongly suggest you ask for Doug.

name: Suzanne McCreedy, Esq.
text: Their technician, Randy Wilson, came out to repair a new dryer that I purchased. He was great! Randy immediately knew how to resolve the problem, and took care of it. He was very professional, friendly, and arrived when he said he would.  This was my first time using this company. I will absolutely use these folks again!

name: Asaf Stein
text:
1 star is too much. Unprofessional, disorganized, waste of time and money and patience. DO NOT under any circumstances hire these worthless morons to work on your home.

Like most people here, they came to work on my house through a home warranty. They took months to order parts, 8 or 9 no shows with no calling. Showed up late with out parts.

It’s like I hired the federal government to fix my dishwasher.

Worst experience of my life besides my root canal.

name: Tess Waters
text: They charged me a $95 service fee to come out and "look" at my washer to tell me nothing was wrong with it and said it would be an additional fee to start servicing and find the problem. I called to see what all my warranty covered and the lady I talked with told me that it was only a 5 year when everywhere else was saying 10 year warranty. When I was asking what the fee was for since he didn't do anything. Literally did absolutely nothing. She replied with a smug attitude "You don't think we come out there for free do you?" I asked for a manager and of course one wasnt available and I asked to be called back and that still hasn't happened. Absolute worst customer service I've ever had. DO NOT USE THEM!!

name: Kaitlyn York
text: I wasted $60 on a service call with this company. I explained the door would fall down and  the dishwasher was not cleaning well and the "technician" cycled it and said "everything sounds good" and told me that I was using the wrong kind of detergent and left. He was at my house for a total of 10 minutes.

name: Melissa Freeman
text: Worst company to deal with. Zero customer service. My warranty company requested this company so I'm thinking they are a reputable company.   When I made the appointment, I asked them to call me ahead of time (30 minutes to an hour) to let me know when they were coming out so I could take off work. I said if they could not do this I would take off work as I have been without a washing machine since November and going to the laundry-mat cost me about $50.00 a month. The guy that made the appointment said that would not be a problem for him to call an hour ahead of time. I had to wait two weeks just to get the appointment. I was not happy about having to wait two weeks but no problem, I will do whatever it takes.  They are in Bessemer AL, I am in Pensacola Florida. You would think sometime on the way the technician would have time to make a courtesy call to say "I'm heading your way".  I received a call when the technician was at my home. He didn't leave a message on my voicemail so I'm thinking I just received a call from an unknown caller. He called again so I called him immediately back.  The phone rang once and when straight to a recording that he does not have voicemail set up. I  automatically left work and would be at my home within 10 minutes. So while driving to my home just incase it is the technician.  I call their office. They said he just left my home. I asked if he could go back  I will be there in 10 minutes. They said I need to call my warranty company and reschedule. Then I call the unknown number back and speak to Adam. He said he called me 4 times. I said he called me twice not 4 times and I called him immediately back after the second call.  I asked if he could come back. He said his office is 71 miles away and he was already half way there. Unless this guy is flying this is not possible as all of this took place within a 20 minute time span from my phone records. I will be filing a formal complaint with my warranty company, the better business bureau and the department that issued this company a license.

name: Nicole Thompson
text: My technician has had to come out to my house several times for my oven. He is so sweet everytime! Always calls and lets me know when he is on his way. His name is Tommy Kennedy. Very fast work also!!

name: Henry Wilson
text: My experience with them. I called because an icemaker quit working. The tech came out and turned it on, listened and discovered the compressor wasn't turning on. He never tested the compressor with a meter, never even rolled the machine out from where it was sitting to look at the compressor or any other components. He told me the compressor was bad and it would cost $700 plus to repair it.  I pulled up you tube and watched a few videos on testing compressors, tested it, and it tested fine. I started testing other items until I got to the control board. When i removed it and looked at it, there was an obvious problem where a solder joint had melted away on a relay contact. I tested the relay and it was still working, so i soldered it back, put the machine back together, and it has been cranking out ice ever since. The $85 I paid these people was a complete waste and I am not confident that they know what they are doing.

name: Yvette Kittell
text: Had an appointment scheduled for today, from 8-12. Around 11:30, I called to find out where my tech was and was told by Randy that he was still on job #2. And job #3 still needed attention. I took the day off from work because they told me they would be here between 8-12. Randy made excuses for the tech not showing up on time and didn't offer a solution. Don't call whirlpool and schedule your repairs with them because that's who they will contact. And maybe I got bad service because I live in the South and people in these parts don't like to work and know nothing about customer service.

name: Stephanie Edwards
text: I wish I could leave ZERO stars. This company does NOT care about its customers. S&S came out on a Whirlpool Warranty call (which is probably the reason they didn't care too much to begin with). This was his THIRD time out. I confirmed via email the day before for the 12-5 time slot. He had the address and all codes he needed. He called me at 12:59pm saying if he didn't get a call back within 10 minutes he was moving on. I was in a work meeting. Why don't they call 30 minutes out when they're on the way like other companies? Why did he need me to call him back after I already confirmed I'd be there the day before? Called customer service and they refused to help me, saying I should have just answered the phone. They just wanted to reschedule- for a FOURTH time. Unacceptable.

name: Mary Hendry
text: I have had a HORRIFIC experience trying to get a service from a PAID for extended warranty and I am in coverage. PLEASE be aware that this company treats you like they are doing you a favor or providing services for free that you should be GRATEFUL to even receive.  This is NOT how to treat customers in business.  I had to refuse to allow them to provide service I did pay for due the customer service being intolerable.   The service is NOT free and I am the customer.  Something has been confused with S & S Appliance because they do not agree with this mentality.  I did ask to speak to manger 2 times  and was refused both times, 1st time Buck told he was at lunch and 2nd time Carla, after saying " he does not want to" then stopping herself said  he was in meeting with the owner his father Tim Powers.

name: Mike Quattlebaum
text:
Great customer service spoke with Annette she was very polite and informed.
Answered all my questions quickly and professional

name: Melissa Gullatte
text: We bought a Maytag washer from Lowe's and bought the extra warranty. When our washer broke shortly after, Lowe's set us up with S&S to come fix it. They have been out to look at our washer a total of FOUR times already and have yet to fix the problem. We have been without a washer for six weeks. They seem to be dragging their feet in fixing the problem and are in absolutely no hurry to order the parts. Thankfully this is covered under our warranty through Lowe's because I would be another level of angry if we were having to pay for each service visit. I would avoid this company at all costs.

name: Joseph Ingram
text: The guys were very courteous and professional. Joe took care of our problem and we will definitely be using them again if a need arises! Thanks again!

name: Michael Upton
text: Friendly staff very helpfull

name: Faith Kaiser
text: They are always very late and service men Do not know what they are doing OR MORE THAN LIKELY it is a SCAM they run with Home Warrenty companies. $500 later in service calls, a new motor for a dishwasher that STLL does not get dishes clean. Their solution for $100 service call? Dry Aid! Really?

name: Hayden Lee
text: I waited 8 days for a technician to come out and look at my machine that is still under warranty. While at my home with me in the next room technician dropped my washer he had propped against the wall and put a hole in my newly painted wall and didn't even acknowledge it! name: Daniel Marchand
text:
I wouldn't use this company again. I have a Bosch Dishwasher that had an issue under manufacture warranty and unfortunately the closest authorized Bosch repair vendors was this one (who has an auxiliary service center in Huntsville), and another company in Birmingham (The Birmingham place seemed very nice on the phone, but I didn't want to wait a couple weeks for a tech to fix it... so I called S&S).

First off after calling the other repair place in Birmingham, I found the lady on the phone at S&S very rushy - just wanted name, address, payment method got me off the phone quick... the other repair place took down all my info, make/model, serial #, everything and was going to preorder potential parts so they could do one visit and be done. Dispite my initial impression of calling S&S I went with them anyway since they could come out in 2-3 days vice 1-2 weeks. (when your used to having a dishwasher it's not fun when it's broken...)

So the first guy comes out, looks at the dishwasher, deems we need a new sump pump, leaves. 2nd visit he comes by installs the new part does a really quick test and deems its fixed and leaves.  My wife goes to run the dishwasher on a full cycle and the draining error code comes up again.

I called the company and was informed someone was coming out the next day to check it. This time we get a guy who didn't even know how to spell Bosch (OK I'm exagerating, but in his words he never seen this kind of dishwasher... had no clue how to work it, fix it, nothing...), treated my wife horribley, he had to call Bosch to walk him through troubleshooting, then proceeds to berate my wife saying it's our plumbing get a plumber the dishwasher is fine, and threatens to charge us if we call for warranty purposes again since it is our plumbing.

Just to give this jerk the benefit of the doubt I took apart the piping under my sink and found no blockages (cleaned it a bit anyway), the sink the dishwasher was hooked to for drainage has never had issues... as far as the intall it was professionally installed by Lowe's and has worked flawless for 11 months so how the heck can it be my plumbing?

After fooling with it more myself I found out when the 1st guy replaced our pump it ajared the door that covers the sump pump from the inside of the dishwasher, and some food was caught in there. After I cleaned it and reseated the door correctly it worked fine again...

In summary my experience: Curt, rushy phone operator; experienced, but in a hurry repair tech (1st and 2nd visit same guy); and lastly rude and unknowledgeable repair tech (3rd visit).

Next time if I had to choose between this place and the Birmingham repair place I'll take my chances with how long it takes the Birmingham folks to come out.... I'd rather wait a week longer and have someone take the time to fix it right then some half fast job, but you know it's all about the $$ the more jobs they cram into a day the more $$ they take in so this is what you get.

name: Iona
text: Appliance care pros showed up when no one would. We were lucky to have found them. Out of the blue our microwave door stopped opening just one month after the warranty was up. Noodles were left in it. We tried GE who claimed there was no one in the area to come and fix it. We tried Sears whom were crazy expensive. And another local well known company in the area that told us they could fix it but we would have to wait a couple weeks for them to come out. Went to Rix and asked Bubba did he know anybody. And he gave me Appliance care pro number. They came out the same night. And saved us money by not having to buy parts. THANK YOU SO MUCH!!

resp.text: You are so welcomed. Appreciate the kind review.

text: They did not show, nor did they call for any reason.   I can’t stand the fact that I took a day off work for their services and got a no show with no call.

name: Josh Waldeck
text: Absolutely the guy to call in the Auburn area for any and all appliance issues. Extremely smart, friendly, accessible, and above all, willing to teach you what’s going on with your appliance. He came over on a Sunday to help diagnose a broken dryer, and even followed up to make sure everything else was working well. Literally haven’t left a review on google maps yet, but this business deserves it.

resp.text: Thank you Josh! Always happy to help.

name: Randy Boone
text: Our refrigerator went out on a Sunday afternoon, so we called four appliance repair services in hopes of finding one who might be willing to help us save our food.  Of the four messages we left, the good folks at Appliance Care Pros were the ONLY ones to call us back.  Not only that, but they had a professional to us within an hour.  The technician arrived exactly when he said he would and went to work.  There was no guesswork involved.  After quickly diagnosing the problems, he provided us with a plan of action.  As you can expect, there were no parts available on a Sunday, so the technician provided us a temporary work-around to get our fridge up and running until the parts could be installed.  We couldn't be happier with the service we received...they even checked in with us to make sure the temporary fix was working as expected!  Our fridge was up and running in no time and Appliance Care Pros has another happy customer.  Highly Recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Randy! We hope your refrigerator is still doing well.

name: Eric Martin
text:
Worst experience ever:

Sorry for the long review guys: Please Read!!!

First off, my home warranty referred me to this establishment, so I decided to give it a shot. I called HARE APPLIANCE numerous times and it always goes to voicemail. I left a professional message each time. He called back 2 weeks later and scheduled an appointment for Monday, November 2nd 2020. Today, Tuesday November 3rd and says he didn’t make the appointment for Monday and stated he really don’t want to come to my house for the repairs in the first place due to him not wanting to use home warranty. I explained to him that I would personally pay him and my home warranty would reimburse me. I put off plans for other businesses to come because I saw the review and assumed he was legit.  Please do not use this guy, I refuse to beg to spend my money for this type of disservice. I will contact my home warranty after this review and ensure none else goes through this foolishness.

Very unprofessional

name: Brian McLean
text: Superb responsiveness.  I called about problems with my 13 year old washing machine.  Got a timely call back, Mr. Hare diagnosed the problem from the description on the phone, and advised me that it would not be worth the money to fix it.  No charge and he even gave me a recommendation for a good quality make and model to replace.  Plus he was a pleasure to talk with.  This is the old time, small town friendly service that I grew up with; glad to see that it is still around.

name: Michael Dopson
text:
Appears that we have "mice". They had chewed up the water lines. Ordered new water hoses,  Sam came and installed them and left. I ran the dishwasher the next day and had water running out all over my kitchen floor.
Apparently the mice have already chewed up the "new" hoses. Atlas has been good to work with my problem and we've scheduled a pest control company to kill the mice.

5/11/12 Sam came out again to replace the second set of hoses eaten by mice. Suggested a couple of "trade secrets" to deter the mice. Hoping this will be a fix for my water lines for awhile.

resp.text: We’re sorry to hear about your experience Mr. Dopson. We spoke with the technician and he has it very well documented that rodents of some sort has been your problem. The multiple trips have been due to each time we arrive something being damaged. Even the water issue is due to the new hoses the technician installed being damaged within a day. Unfortunately we can not stop a rodent from damaging your machine but we can always fix it for you if the problems continue!

Whitten, the technician who showed up was on time, actually they called because he was running ahead of schedule so he was technically early and that worked out better for me and he was so polite, professional and was sensitive to the fact that if we tried to install this part and it was wrong, I was stuck with it. text:

Also, the company's front office is efficient in contacting clients and providing updates on the specialist's arrival.  This all points to great customer service!

text: I was very, very pleased with the the service I received yesterday from Mr. Appliance of Huntsville. I will definitely use them again if  the need arises and I recommend them to anyone having a problem with an appliance!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words and thank you for trusting Mr Appliance! We will be sure to let Kenneth know!

name: Michael Bozeman
text: The young man was polite, professional and did a great job! I had called three other places and no one could get out anytime soon.  Mr Appliance came out within two days! Would definitely use again!

text: Chris did a great job explaining the repair he was performing! Very timely service with good communication and scheduling.

name: John Richard
text: Arrived during appointed time.  Diagnosed problem and had to order a part.  Returned and installed new part and explained warranty.   Very happy with service.

name: Donald Apostolico
text: Mike was prompt , professional and repaired our dryer quickly. Highly recommend.

name: J Lavalley
text:
This vendor's business operations need work. I set up an appointment through parent company Neighborly online. First available appointment was a two-week wait. Appointment time came and went. I contacted Neighborly, which redirected me to Mr. Appliance. Scheduler there said there was no appointment. Scheduler told me that they would call Neighborly to confirm. I received a call the next day, asking if I was available the following day, to which I replied that I was.

Repair professional Chris was on time, friendly, and knowledgeable. He fixed the refrigerator within an hour. Absolutely no complaints about Chris. His work was excellent. Part and labor came with a 1-year warranty.

Additionally, I chose Neighborly because I have a credit account with Neighborly from another local repair vendor. Mr. Appliance told me they would accept the account, but when the time came to pay, the system would not accept a Neighborly revolving credit account through Synchrony, because the card I have has no date on it.

If you need work on an appliance, I recommend calling this vendor directly and using a debit card or major credit card. Also, in the current times, expect to have to wait a couple weeks, because home repair professionals are booked solid.

name: Mandy Evanko
text: Jeremy is the best. Mr. Appliance is very professional and quick to describe exactly what they are doing to repair. Will definitely be using them in the future.

name: Garrett Hipkins
text: Very easy to work with. Super nice and helpful technicians.

name: Mariann Dunlap
text: The technician who came to repair our freezer was very knowledgeable and he spent good quality time diagnosing and fixing the problem,

name: Diana Ross
text: Michael was very professional and knowledgeable. I was very pleased with his service.

name: Melissa Derrick
text: Kenneth knew exactly what he was doing and was fast at repairing/replacing our oven part. He actually came earlier than the projected time window they gave for that day but the new time worked out better with my schedule anyways. I would definitely recommend this company.

name: Colton R
text: We had a problem with our refrigerator and Jeremy came out with a quick response. He provided some very honest and helpful feedback. Outstanding experience and we'll be using this company again in the future for any of our needs!

name: Drake Maxwell
text: We cannot say enough good things about Jeremy from Mr. Appliance. He arrived on time and wore shoe coverings in the house along with a mask. He was very knowledgeable about the service call on our oven and he took the time to educate us about our stove and oven. Jeremy is very personable. He is a great representative of Mr Appliance and because of him I wholeheartedly recommend Mr Appliance for your home repair needs!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words and thank yo for trusting Mr Appliance

name: Victoria Wright
text: First time we used them, the technician came out and spent a couple hours looking at the fridge, said the new noise it was making was normal. We called and made another appointment a few weeks later when the compressor was starting to fail, they no call/no showed us. Called to reschedule, they said due to snowstorms they didn't know what the schedule would look like and would have to call us back, which is understandable. However, we never received a call back. Ended up having to call Samsung directly to send someone out to look at the fridge since at that point it had completely died.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback however we are unable to locate your service record by your name or Google information to review the circumstances of your service event. We, like every business in Huntsville area, were impacted by the snow event and did not run service at the request of the state (keeping non emergency vehicles off the road to allow emergency vehicles priority). It is unusual for us not to reschedule an appointment but it certainly can happen for a variety of reasons such as not being able to make contact for several days. We were actively booking reschedules when customers called but we were in fact booking into the next week at that time due the being closed several days. We never tell someone we don't know when we can come out as we keep schedules open at least a month in advance (Some customers request appointment dates several weeks in advance).  We are happy Samsung was able to dispatch and get you resolved! Thank you

name: Jaquelyn Summers
text: Chris was our repairman and he was very prompt and courteous.  He had to replace our ice maker and the cost was very reasonable for his service call and the new icemaker.

name: Sandra King
text:
I have a dryer which was under warranty with GE. GE scheduled with this company. A part was ordered and I was told it should be within the week. After 2 weeks of not hearing from anyone, I called checking.  I was told there was a shipping mistake and was told they would reorder the part and it should be in a couple of days.  I called back after 3 business days and they said part was in. I said Great, can we get
That installed as I have been without a dryer almost 3 weeks. Guy was very nice and said we can schedule u 7 days from today! I explained the situation but was told that was the first available. If they knew the part would be in a couple of days and they know they run a week out- They should have scheduled at the time
Part was ordered..I’m sure if part was not in the day before scheduled appt, someone on the schedule would be happy to move up.  The company does
Good work...I’m wanting people to know so if they have an appliance that impacts daily life, they may want to schedule return appt when part is ordered

resp.text: Thank you so much for your candid feedback. We do, and have, used predictive scheduling for years however, for the past year, the pandemic has dramatically impacted shipping and delivery. FedEx and UPS in particular have dropped their guarantees. While we strive continuously to overcome the gaps, we still suffer delays and scheduling conflicts. We feel your pain! We literally make hundreds of phone calls every day to try and update everyone and clearly we could do better since we didn't make positive contact with you! These agents spend their entire day on the phone attempting to keep everyone updated! We cannot find you based on your google profile. If you would contact our office email contact@mrappliancehuntsville.com we will make every possible effort to get you going. We have customers reschedule for a variety of reasons every day and I feel sure we can get you sooner service!

name: Seth Cole
text: Had a broken whirlpool fridge we bought in 2019. They “fixed” the wrong thing and charged $200 plus. When we called them back out because their work didn’t resolve issues, they found something else that needed to be fixed for another $200 plus but wouldn’t give credit for their failed first attempt. They will not call back when you ask for details about charges or how they could have been so wrong in their diagnosis. My recommendation: look elsewhere.

resp.text:
We are very sorry for your experience. sounds like the tech miscommunication the service. Please contact Beth or Cara at the office and we will definitely resolve your issue!
Thanks!

name: Geralyn Donnelly
text: Technicians are very knowledgeable, prompt, and they clean up when they're done!  We will not hesitate to call again for other service.

name: Barbara Young
text: Greg worked professional he worked diligently. He didn't have all the parts so he went to get them and returned less than one hour!!! My dyer is functioning better than it was when I purchased. I will definitely 👍 recommend you to family and friends. I will use Mr. Appliance of Huntsville for repair of all my appliances in the future. Thanks Greg. Job well done 👏.

We will definitely call them as well as the other Neighborly companies when we need service in our home.

text: Ceacila with Mr Appliance came to my house to look at my washing machine. She had to be at my house a few hours to figure out the problem but she stayed patient and helpful! Unfortunately, I would have had to have my outer tub completely replaced and it costs just as much as a new washing machine. Needless to say I will be buying a new washing machine but Ceacila was so nice and helpful and she even recommended a certain type of washing machine so I will definitely be buying that brand. I hope I don’t have to get any appliances fixed any time soon, but if I do I will call Mr. Appliance again.

name: Ralph Weber
text: All we needed was the "flipper" on the left door of our LG refrigerator replaced. Actually, all it needed was a spring, but I guess you can't buy just a spring. Anyway we had to order the part and wait for delivery. It was replaced in 30 minutes and now works beautifully.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback! Yes, many manufacturers now only offer replacement parts as assemblies. The good news is we warranty our work for a full year! Thanks for trusting Mr Appliance!

text: Jeremy, our technician, was extremely helpful, knowledgeable, professional, yet very warm and friendly. He did an outstanding job repairing our icemaker - and was very kind in dealing with us.  His customer service is exemplary!

name: Tim Mc
text: The repairmen Kenneth texted to let me know he was on the way. He arrived on time, evaluated the problem and told me the cost for the repair. He left for a brief time to get a part and returned and promptly fixed the problem. He was very professional. I highly recommend this company!

name: Brian Bach
text: Called yesterday for a no heat electric dryer. They came today found out the thermostat assembly was bad on a 20 year old dryer. They fixed it with replacement parts in 52 minutes. Amazing..

name: Donna Curtiss
text: I have had the pleasure of dealing with three separate Mr. Appliance servicemen. One to repair my mother's Samsung ice maker, one to repair my Whirlpool dishwasher and one to repair my Whirlpool ice maker. All three were professional, courteous, and very knowledgeable. They quickly figured out what was wrong with all three appliances and had two of the three parts on hand to repair them. The third part was installed within a few days, so downtime was minimal.  The office staff is very courteous and responsive, as well. They texted me when the serviceman was on the way with his name and picture so I knew who was coming. I would highly recommend this company!

name: mary spears
text: I was sure my aging dishwasher was a goner, but the Mr. Appliance techs had it fixed in two hours, including having to run out for the part.  Thank you!

Thank you for letting us know of the issue you had during the repair process. We stand behind our work with a full one year warranty. We will review the process with the technician and correct. We will be in contact with you today to resolve any outstanding issues.
Thank you for trusting Mr Appliance and we look forward to serving you in the future!

name: Stephanie Bean
text: Our technician was well-informed and efficient. He even made sure he had likely parts on hand when he arrived, after having read my description of the problem when he received the assignment.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words and thank you for trusting Mr Appliance!

name: Kimberly Chambers
text: Had our ice maker repaired.  Great communication, on time, professional service, and got the job done.

name: Gracie Hoard
text: Did not come back in a timely manner to fix my washer after I waited 2 weeks for the part that tech said would be there in 3 or 4 days. Did not contact me as promised. I would never recommend them to anyone period.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback. We did call you multiple times attempting to repair your Samsung washer. After you either refused to schedule or even take our calls we sent your ticket back to Samsung. You did not wait for us. We waited for you multiple times. Good luck with your repairs.

name: Carolyn Figueroa
text:
I’ve used Mr. Appliance several times and have always have always had good experiences. This time was a disaster. The technician they sent, I don’t remember his name, Tori or something, was not very friendly at all. We told him our dryer wasnt drying and our dial wasn’t working so the dryer wasn’t shutting itself off. Well, he fixed the dryer for $257 then we reminded him that the dial wasn’t working either he quoted us an extra $200. I was suspicious that now that we had a new heater the dial would work again. So I told him no thanks on the extra $200. Then we asked if they could hold a check for one day until our pay day because we weren’t expecting $257. He said no. So we scraped up part cash and wrote a check for $192 which was all we had in our account.
Lo and behold, when I tried the dryer after he left the dial worked perfectly. 1) He knew it would, he was just trying to screw us out of $200 more dollars. 2) If he didn’t know then he should have since he works on dryers.
Fast forward 2 weeks, my check that they wouldn’t hold for 1 measly day still had not cleared the bank. Called Marie and she talked to the supervisor and she called me back and said that they posted my check but did not know where it was. They would have another supervisor call. No word for another week. Fearing my check lost, and with no communication from the company, I stopped payment on the check for $25 out of my pocket. Miraculously, it tried to post that very same day and was rejected since I had stopped payment.  My husband called them to give them our debit card for the $192 and they started raising hell saying they were adding a fee of $5. My husband who is a pushover paid the extra $5.
How dare they charge me a fee when my check was in la la land for 3 weeks and they never called me back and I had to come out of pocket $25 to stop the check fearing it was lost. How about you pay ME $25 for losing my check for 3 weeks? Or how about let’s call it even. But no, they accepted no responsibility for my check taking 3 weeks to clear. (If it was posted like they said it should have cleared well before that)never apologized and raised hell until they pumped 5 more dollars for their mistake.
I WILL NEVER USE THESE INCOMPETENT,STUPID CROOKS EVER AGAIN. Perhaps, the people in you’re billing department should have at least a 5th grade education when dealing with people’s money. And, a lesson on how to pick up the phone and communicate with a customer would be nice too.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your feedback. We are sorry we did not meet your expectations during the repair process. In Alabama, it is a crime to present worthless check. We process all payments timely but occasionally it takes several weeks for checks to post and process for a variety or reasons. We always give customers an opportunity to correct a worthless check before turning it over to the state, as we did with you. We also stand behind all our work for a full year! If one of our technicians makes a mistake, we do everything in our power to correct that mistake. The $5 charge covers the fine we incurred from our bank.
If we can be of any assistance in the future, please don't hesitate to call!

name: Tracey Lawrence
text: Excellent service!! Extremely kind people to deal with!!

name: Kelly Hudson
text: Have had to have several things worked on in our home:  Stove, refrigerator and dryer.  They have done a terrific job each time in resolving the issue and getting things running like they should.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great feedback and thanks for trusting Mr Appliance.

name: Susan Blades
text: excellent communication and prompt service.  No complaints.

name: Victoria Davis
text: The repairman took his time and made sure that the job was done right. He spent a lot of time on the phone with the manufacturer of my appliance and not only repaired the item, but corrected improper installation issues caused by another contractor.

name: Gary Gramiccioni
text: Cara the scheduler/dispatcher is always excellent to work with.   Today being Saturday we had an issue with Part Warehouses being closed but Cara scheduled Jeremy Cowan to stop by to take a look at our Fridge/Freezer as all our food/meats were starting to thaw.  Jeremy found the issue, turned out to be a gasket interrupting the fan operation - we're back-up and running with just a nominal service charge.   Excellent!!   Thank you Jeremy and thank you Cara!!  You guys are great to work with!

name: Rick Talley
text: Technician was very professional and did an excellent job.

name: Holly Andrews
text: Amazing and trustworthy business. Jon was very professional and extremely helpful!

name: D T
text: Very good service and very professional.

name: Sam Q
text:
Mr. Appliance of Huntsville is truly the best. They are honest, professional and care about their customers’ satisfaction. Chris came to our house and fixed a tricky water leak that was not easy to find in our refrigerator. He did an excellent job….THANK YOU. The office staff and the dispatcher Cara are also great and very understanding and worked around my schedule.The technician also sent a text before arriving, which was another additional helpful tool.
Our experience was very positive with Mr. Appliance of Huntsville. We will definitely use them again and highly recommend them to others.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!

name: Margo Ellison
text:
Jeremy was so great, on time and fixed several appliances, one that had never been installed correctly.
Very impressed with Mr Appliance!

name: Alan Miller
text: The ice maker Input was splattering water due to water pressure. There was a crack in the plastic line also which he fixed.  We didn’t notice that the ice maker only dispensed crushed ice.  Called back and will get fixed soon.

name: Jo Wa
text: Have had fair assessments and repair pricing from them. Several repairs over the years on personal equipment and appliances in rental houses.

resp.text: Thank you for trusting us to meet your needs!

name: Scott Boswell
text: Excellent repair and customer service by technician Jeremy!  He went above and beyond to ensure it was done correctly and that I was satisfied.  Definitely recommend.

name: David Cantrell
text: The technicians arrived on time, diagnosed the problem, provided a reasonable quote. They returned when the parts came in and fixed the issue and corrected some installation issues from the Big Box store installers.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and thank you for trusting Mr Appliance

name: Wendy Carey
text: Tech starts walking in my home while on the phone.  Saying let me check this one out to whoever he is on phone with.  Then as he is opening drawer to freezer, within 30 seconds of being in my home he begins with well I really dont know....  that's a warm fuzzy for sure....🙄 then tells me its possible my freezer is too cold.  Again doesnt really know what's wrong with ice maker but doesnt recommended installing new one if this one still works.  Uhm it doesnt work, that's why you are here  Recommends I spray Pam or put butter in trays to help ice fall from tray.  ??? (Uhm what)When I requested price of new maker he pretty much ends his service. Writes up bogus ticket to get price.  Shows me a cost that's a 3rd of the price of new fridge.  When I mention such he says well you can put this one in garage ..and make it your beer fridge and buy a new un.. so needless to say I paid the $90 service fee with no repair plan mentioned....thank you Mr. APPLIANCE for very knowledgeable service...🙄🙄🙄🙄🙄😒

resp.text: Wendy, thank you for the feedback. Chris normally receives glowing feedback so we were a bit surprised by your experience. We will speak with Chris to resolve. Meanwhile we will reach out to you by phone, possibly send a different technician to resolve your issue. We do apologize for the big miss on our part!

name: Craig Culpepper
text: Fast friendly, service

name: Slade McElroy
text: I have used them on more than one occasion and they have been speedy, courteous, and extremely professional! Kenneth has always given his honest opinion after running diagnostics and I will continue to use this company in the future because of that!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback and Thank You for trusting Mr Appliance!

name: JW Hale
text: Repairman was an absolute professional and did a truly outstanding job. His customer service and appliance knowledge is above measure. One of kind. I highly recommend these folks for appliance repairs. Very cost effective and customer friendly. Again, great job!

name: huey edmondson
text: I was very impressed with their professionalism and service. Our technician Jeremy Cowan was professional and courteous and I would absolutely call and ask for him again if I ever need additional appliance service!

name: Chris Reid
text: Chris did a great job job. He was on time and friendly. He accurately diagnosed the problem and fixed it quickly. He had the right parts with him, too. The refrigerator works great now.

name: Leah Wiggins
text: Jeremy Cowan was my service professional.  He was wonderful. He fixed my Jen-nair Gas Oven.  He diagnosed the problem and had it fixed in less than an hour.  Was very cordial and courteous.  I will definitely call Mr. Appliance again.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! We appreciate your business

name: schadowolf
text: Mr. Appliance of Huntsville is my first choice for appliance repair. Have used them several times, very professional, courteous, and enthusiastic about not only fixing the problem but informing/instructing customers on maintenance etc that you don't hear about when you initially purchase a product (ie a front loading washer....). Jeremy Cowan was the technician who serviced our washer and he was terrific! He took the time to explain what happened, how to maintain the washer on a per use/monthly and three month schedule. I highly recommend Mr. Appliance and Jeremy in particular to fix your appliance issues!

name: Kent Jackson
text: Knowledgeable and quick service!

name: Gayle Phillips
text: This was my first time using Mr. Appliance and I was very pleased. The service rep came out to the house twice in 3 business days, one to assess and the second to fix. He was extremely knowledgeable about the service he was performing and even called the manufacturer to see if there were any known issues or recalls. He also showed me what he was doing, explained why and gave me pointers on how to make some fixes on my own.

name: John Woracek
text: Jeremy Cowan was my service professional. He came to fix my LG front load washer. Based on my input he brought a drain pump with him. He replaced that pump as mine had failed. When he was done he check out the system and decided there was a potential leak and so he repeated the installation process and verify there was no leak. He was very professional and I would recommend him and Mr Appliance.

name: Allison
text: Jeremy the technician that did our repair was very polite. Great experience!

name: Kay Detter
text: Semi-annual ice maker maintenance and filter change.

name: wyndee townley
text: This is a company that will follow through on what they promise. We had a rough start, and I was quite irritated with the tech. After the owner was made aware of the situation, he began the process of making our situation right.  I'm happy to say my dishwasher is back to running and I'm very very pleased with the customer service from Mr. Appliance. Everyone I spoke with and dealt with was professional, exceptionally nice, and very understanding. They went above and way beyond the standard to make sure our situation was corrected and that we were happy. Thanks to everyone at the company for helping us through our dishwasher disaster.

resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback. Our mission is to “To create an encore experience that you can’t wait to share with your friends and family and everyone else”, clearly we missed the mark. Your satisfaction is our primary goal, this is why we offer an industry leading one year warranty on all of our work. Our manager will be reaching out to you to resolve.

Thank you

name: Jeff Case
text: After a frustrating day of waiting for a NO SHOW, company yesterday, Kennth, with Mr Appliance, was on time, and fixed our oven, today! I think for a reasonable price, and the fact they have year warranty is good. I recommend!

name: Susan Bacon
text: They were quick to respond to our call. They let us know pretty close to when they would arrive and then called a few minutes before they actually arrived.  The repair person was courteous, cleaned up after themselves, communicated exactly what was wrong with our washer,  and laid out our options with no pressure.  Great service!

name: Mary Casey
text: Great Job.  Helpful information.

name: PamLa 5 Foot 3
text: I have added this company to my Maintenance Repair List

name: Jane Pavis
text: They did a great job.  The staff and technician were extremely polite and courteous.  The tech fixed my problem right away at a fair price.  I highly recommend Mr. Appliance.

name: Wanda Chambers
text: Jeremy Cowan was our service tech. He was very professional and was able to assess and fix the problem with our dryer switch. It was great that the company gives you a time window of arrival as well as a picture of the tech that is coming. They also followed up with a phone call when he was enroute. Jeremy arrived w/shoe covers introduced himself and made sure the dryer was tested after he fixed the problem. He was also very informative in giving me some preventive measures for dryer maintenance.

I’ve only had a dryer repaired from Mr Appliance of HSV, but I will definitely be calling them back when my next appliance breaks.  My tech was honest, capable and very quick.   Basically my entire dryer had to be disassembled and he had it fixed in minutes. I’d highly recommend them.

I also got a 1-year warranty on my dryer’s operation which was a huge bonus!!  Wasn’t expecting that, but I’ll take it!

I'm especially grateful to Cara the dispatcher, because she understood my anxiousness and was very kind.  Dave, the Service Tech was also very professional.  I won't hesitate to call Mr. Appliance in the future.  Their service call was very fair, in light that they were aware from the beginning that it was an emergency.

name: WALTER MINTZ
text: A very special Thanks to Jeremy Cowan of Mr. Appliance for the courteous and professional service that we received on a recent repair of our stove.

name: Kelli Johnson
text: I was highly impressed with their professionalism and service. The repairs were done well and in a timely manner. The technician was courteous and provided excellent service. It was my first time to use this business for repairs, but it definitely won’t be my last.

name: R.L. Scott
text: Great experience!  The technician (Jeremy Cowan) was prompt, courteous, and very knowledgable. He was even willing to come out on Saturday mornings to accomodate our busy schedule.  I would highly recommend Mr. Appliance of HSV and especially Jeremy Cowan!

resp.text: Thank you very much for the kind words! So glad we were able to take care of all your needs!

name: R Trev
text: They are a good and reliable service.

name: Wayne McDonald
text: I would recommend Mr. Appliance to anyone.  Very professional, knowledgeable, and efficient in their work.  The tech was very considerate of his working environment and left the area neat and clean just as he found it.  I will use them for any future appliance repairs required.

name: Kim Jones
text: Technician, Jeremy, was very honest and helpful

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and thank you for trusting Mr Appliance.

name: Ron Warner
text: Fast, efficient, tech ( Jeremy Cowan) was very professional. Highly recommend!

name: Mark Knight
text: Prompt, friendly and knowledgeable tech.  Proactive scheduling that got my issue resolved much faster than the initial estimate.  Tech was very informative and kept me engaged as he worked my issue.  Very good experience with this company.

name: Charlotte Surber
text: I'm so glad we called Mr. Appliance.  My dishwasher went out and my neighbor recommended them. They sent someone right away and diagnosed the problem and gave me a quote for the price. The part had to be ordered and two days later they had it installed and working perfectly.Very happy.

name: Ls Sheldon
text: This month we called Mr. Appliance of Huntsville for repairs to our refrigerator and dryer.  Their tech, Jeremy Cowan, was on time, was very knowledgeable about both appliances, and did excellent repair jobs at a reasonable price.

name: Ray Hurst
text: Service was fine, price was highly inflated. Replaced a dryer heating coil, a $50. part and charged $250. Repair took approximately 10-15 minutes.

resp.text:
Hi Ray,

Thank you for the feedback! We value our customers' opinions and business, and we only use top quality/ OEM parts. It’s not always the cheapest option, but our mission isn’t to be the “cheap” solution, but rather the best quality solution for you. Other service providers offer a 30 or 90 day warranty, whereas we offer a 1 year part and labor warranty on all our residential work! We also value your time, so our technicians work quickly and accurately, charging by the job, not the hour. You will never pay an overtime charge with us. Again, thank you for sharing your experience with us, and we hope you'll come back in the future!

name: Laura Yates
text: It was a very pleasant experience starting with the lady that answered the phone. She was very polite. She explained in detail their service fee policy and that it would be applied to the repair if a repair was made. The repairman was on time. He was very professional. He had to order a part for refrigerator. He told me exactly how much the repair would cost beforehand. He scheduled another appointment to come do the repair. Once again he was on time and very professional. I highly recommend them.

name: Ann Carter
text: On time and identify the problem referred us to Home Depot to buy another refrigerator and gave us the best brands that he knew.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback!

name: Robert Hurtig
text: While weren't able to handle my request, they were polite and quick in letting me know.

name: Suezy Proctor
text: Mr Appliance is Johnny on the Spot - when I called for a service call for my dryer, Cara found an opening in a two-day window. Service professional, David Mann, called to confirm on the day of the appointment and not only addressed my immediate needs, but gave me important information about our venting system for my husband and I to follow up on. I have used Mr Appliance in the past with a refrigerator problem, and there again Cara got me set up and Tory came and got us up and running in no time. I highly recommend Mr Appliance!

name: Kristi C
text: Scheduled a time (8am-10am) for them to come out through our warranty. Never received a confirmation. At 9am I receive a call saying they have to reschedule for another day because they can't work me in today. How do they decide who gets kicked off the list? I get things happen, but you still have to take care of the customer. I had to take the morning off work and rearrange things to be home for nothing. Very frustrating.

resp.text:
Dear Kristi,

Thank you for the feedback. We strive to accommodate all customer requests and clearly we missed the mark in your case. Unfortunately on the day of your scheduled service, your technician was out sick. Since you live in Hazel Green, an outlying area, there were no other technicians available to run the service call for you on the originally scheduled date. We take your needs seriously, but we also take you and your family’s health seriously and would never send a sick technician into your home and put you at risk.

Hopefully in the future, you will give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations and resolve any appliance repair needs you may have.

name: Nonexistent
text: I was given an appointment that was scheduled a week out from 1p-4p and Jeremy Cowan, the poor technician got caught up with a difficult appliance at the house before me. He didn't make it to my house for my consultation until 5:48 but he had my dryer fixed the next day and he did a great job! Turned my frown upside down!

name: Denise Buchli
text: Excellent communication updates !!!

text: I will absolutely use Mr. Appliance in the future if I have a problem with something.  I had a problem with my fridge.  The tech that came by told me how to keep everything going until he was able to get back with the needed part once they got it in.  They called back to let me know they would have the part in on Friday for installation.  The tech called a couple of days early and asked if I had time for him to swing by and install it since he finished with another job early.  Got me back up and running even sooner than they originally predicted.  Great company to do business with.  :)
