name: Paulette Givhan
text: Service was quick and efficient.  Technician very nice.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review! We appreciate you letting us serve you, and for sharing the word about your service.

name: Al Simmons
text: Excellent on time service.  Courteous and professional.

name: Jroy N
text:
They were on time,friendly, and efficient
Thanks for a great job well done!

name: Joseph Beckham
text: I felt the service was excellent from the order to the tech, who was considerate & professional.

resp.text: Thank you! We're proud of Eddie and our customer service staff. It was our pleasure to serve you.

name: Pamela Gasink
text: We had 2 appliances with issues: a 7 month old GE Profile telescoping downdraft vent (not raising and lowering smoothly) and a Kitchenaid Architect Series dishwasher (leaking water).  The technician, Craig Harris, was professional, personable and most importantly knowledgeable.  After inspecting the downdraft and learning how new it was, he got on the phone with the GE Customer Care Team and they took over the resolution since the product was covered under warranty (in a previous call that I made to GE... they blew me off with the reply that the unit must not have been installed properly... which it was).  That situation was resolved with a swap of the defective GE downdraft.  Craig then diagnosed the DW problem as a broken soap dispenser that was surprisingly allowing the high pressure water to get into a small hole and leak down through the front panel and out to the corners and then onto my floor.  A 2nd visit was required to allow time for the part to be ordered (expensive little plastic booger).  I was very pleased that the very same person was sent for the installation, this rarely seems to happen with most companies. He was very careful not to scratch any outside components or my hardwood kitchen floors.  He was a quick with his work and above all, an expert.

name: thegary clark
text: had an email conformation on a service date, took 1/2 day off to cover the 12-5 service window. No one showed up so I called and was told I had changed the service date. Who the hell does that?

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

Hi, I'm sorry you had this experience. The first service call for the dryer was submitted via our online portal on August 18th at 10pm for a Frigidaire dryer, and scheduled for August 23rd. -- First thing Monday morning, we left a message for the customer to call us to verify the address (and so we could explain what will happen during service visit). -- 10 minutes later, we received a call back and were told that there was another dryer, a Samsung, and would also like that one to be serviced at the same time. A ticket was created at that time, and both were scheduled for the 24th. (Probably because it was now two calls, not just one). -- The initial email confirming the service call would have been sent Friday after the one unit was scheduled online, which is I think the source of the confusion. I'm not sure why the system did not send a followup email with the new information, and I apologize deeply for that. -- We wouldn't claim that the customer called and changed the service date unless we had received a call from someone, and we certainly wouldn't have created a new ticket for this customer unless we had communicated with someone. That just wouldn't make sense for us to do that. -- We're terribly sorry that the experience was confusing, and that you spent time waiting for a call that never came. We take great care to meet and exceed customer expectations, and we will examine our processes in detail to see what could be improved so that this does not happen again.

name: jennifer campbe
text: Great job. Thorough and quick service.

resp.text: Thank you! It was our pleasure serving you.

name: soscout1
text: we called on Friday  but was too close to closing time to have anyone come out, so they made an appointment  to come out on Sat between 9 & 1  to check out our frig.   we CANCELED  a trip to be here and no one ever showed up or called to say they were running later or not going to be able to come !!   HOW UNPROFESSIONAL !!!

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

I truly wish I could give a better response to this review, but since I have no customer information to look up this service, I really can't.

If a call was scheduled Friday night for Saturday morning after our technician's paperwork was printed out, it's possible that this could happen. If we had a telephone number wrong, it's possible also that we would not make it out to your home. But I am just guessing without knowing more about you.

I would love to hear from you via our email address ( service@servicecare.net ) with information about this, so that I can make sure this doesn't happen again. This is not  how we treat our customers.

Thank you,

Toxey McDavid
Service Care, Inc.

name: Jim Jolly
text: The technician was very efficient and pleasant. He sta0yed in touch to make sure things were working well.

resp.text: Thank you! It was our pleasure to serve you.

name: Christina Coleman
text: Most reliable service company in Birmingham!

name: wayne murray
text: They did a great job on my flatscreen.

resp.text: I'm glad to hear it! We were happy to repair your television, and appreciate you.

name: marsha markus
text: Our technician Craig did an excellent job in fixing our problem. We were very pleased and I highly recommend him.

name: Vicki Quick

text: Very knowledgeable. Would ask for Scott next time.

name: Scott Fortenberry
text: On time for appointment. Courteous repair person. Expensive estimate

resp.text:
Thank you for the review Scott, but I'm confused.

The last repair we show for any with your name was for two Panasonic 50" TVs, and the repairs were covered by warranty (so our estimate couldn't have been expensive, at least not for you.) Both of these repairs occurred in September of 2009.

Can you provide me with your invoice # at service@servicecare.net ? I would like to look into this, but unless the repair was under a different name, I think you have Service Care confused with a different servicer.

name: Katherine Allen
text: Service Care is the best!  6 month guarantee on all work...you can't beat that! A+++++++++

text: Clifton very professional and clean and he explained my problem to me after he got finish with diagnostic he told me how much it would cost to fix it

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to write us a review, Shalandia. It's good to hear we could help with your appliance. We appreciate your business!

name: K and K Collection
text: They are a bunch of LIARS . Constantly told me lies regarding a part not being and when it was and they were rude and just push you off . They also try to overcharge you when you come to the store

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

I'm sorry you had a terrible experience but I can't find any record of us providing you or your Boutique with service or parts. If we did, my name is Toxey McDavid and I am the owner of Service Care. Please call me at 205-956-3777 and talk to me, I want to make things right so that you feel like we've given you 5-star service.

name: Brooks Clark
text: We were very disappointed  with the cost of the service provided. We had a service call to check our ice maker. Took 20 minutes to replace a small tube and were handed a bill for $185. When we asked for a break down of the invoice we were told there was an $85 charge for the visit, leaving their cost of $100 for labor and parts. A small piece of rubber tubing and 20 minutes from arrival to departure. They sure think a lot of their time. Never again service care! Wish we could give less than one star for gouging!

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

*We will apply the diagnostic fee to next repair* -- While I stand behind my technician's expertise and super-fast repair, I would never want a customer to feel that we had charged them so much that we earn a 1-star review. I will happily apply the $85 diagnostic fee to your next repair (appliance or television). If you would like to discuss this matter, I would like to hear from you at 956-3777. My name is Toxey McDavid, and I am the owner of Service Care. Thank you.

name: GINA T
text: Serviceman checked out our 10 yr old 61 inch RCA and thoroughly explained the issue and the cost of repair.  Needless to say, my Hubby is getting a new tv.

resp.text:
Hi Gina,

I'm glad our technician was thorough in explaining the problem and cost of the repair.

What could we have done better to have earned a 5 star review from you?

Thank you!

name: Deborah Burtnett
text: Although my technician tried very hard to eliminate the banging and thumping noise on my new LG washing machine, he was unable to completely fix the problem.  As I noted to LG on the website requesting service, I used the troubleshooting feature which indicated a water enabler/regulator might be needed.  I put this in the request for service.  However, after trying some adjustments, the technician said I need a plumber to install that device.  He made some adjustments which decreased some of the loud banging and thumping as the machine fills, but now I need to make another call--to whom?  The tech seemed to think the problem was with our house--water pressure pounding the machine.  How do I resolve this?  Thank you for your help.

name: Heath Baker

We don't want to sell anyone's device, and we certainly don't steal from anyone. ---- If you still feel that you have the right company, I want to hear about your experience. My name is Toxey McDavid, I'm the owner, and I am ready to listen to your complaint (even if it's not about Service Care). Our number is 205-956-3777.

The delivery guys showed up today, Jim & James. Both were incredibly nice, very professional & knowledgeable. They worked hard to install both appliances. My laundry space is very small & it was a bit difficult to maneuver but they did so without complaint at all.
I would definitely recommend Handy TV for any needs & I plan to use them for anything I may need in the future as well. James & Jim went above & beyond expectations. An overall amazing experience on all fronts!

text: I used Mr. Appliance Over the Mountain to fix my stove. They were very quick to contact me and set up an appointment time. Service was on time and prompt. Very satisfied and would recommend and use services again.

text: Colby came in the time window they told me. He worked quickly and efficiently. I'm glad that the part he replaced is under their warranty for a year. I'm satisfied with the service and would definitely use them again if I need an appliance repaired.

name: Sam Kemp
text: Josh was extremely knowledgeable  and professional. We appreciate his ability to solve our refrigerator issue. Josh is a good man.

name: Nate Lawson
text: Hello.  I used Mr Appliance to repair a microwave.  I first had them come look at the microwave a year ago.  A technician came to the house, looked at the microwave for about 5 minutes, didn't touch a thing and said it was the controller that was broken.  He charged his $100 service charge and only after I called would he send me a quote with the part I was supposed to get and the over $600 quote.  I didn't trust him so I never went through with the repair.  After a year of a non-functional microwave, I called again and had a different technician come out.  This guy was way better and actually diagnosed the problem and said it was a completely different part.  same $600.  So this time I had them come fix it.  but when he came out to replace the part (which I later found out could be ordered on the internet for less than $200 and takes all of 5 screws to replace), the part he ordered wasn't functional.  so he frankensteined together part of my old microwave and part of his new part to get it to work.  i guess it works, but when you pay $700 to fix a microwave, I would have liked to get a brand new part.  i tried to call the company to tell them what happened and they did the typical "someone will call you back".  which they never did. i only write this now, because I have since had service by an excellent appliance company called "Appliance Connection". Way better in every single way.

name: Lydia Kirkland
text: I highly recommend Mr. Appliance! They always called when the technician was on the way, Larry was very polite and knowledgeable, and of course our dryer now works!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: James Hall
text: The technician was very professional and polite.  The reason for low rating was I put in my comment that I was having no gas flow to my cooktop.  They came out looked and said you have to call the gas company to fix gas appliances.  For $99 service call to inform me to call someone else is unacceptable, especially  when they were informed  of the issue.  Why advertise you repair gas appliances and then you can't / don't?  I would not recommend them for anything related to gas appliances.

resp.text:
Hello,
I apologize you had a bad experience with our company. We do work on gas appliances however if the appliance has no gas coming into the appliance we recommend a plumber.

text: Great customer service! On time! Actually, the second time I used them, they had a cancellation and called to ask me if I would like the repairman to come early, which I gratefully accepted. They come in, diagnose the problem, fix it, and they're gone. Very efficient and friendly.

text: Mr. Appliance showed up on time and called first to let us know when the repairman was on the way. He was so respectful, and COVID cautious too. He placed a mat outside and placed his shoes there and put on protective slip-ons and wore a well-fitting mask. He thoroughly evaluated and  promptly diagnosed the problem with our oven and gave us the repair estimate with a full explanation. We authorized the repair and he ordered the needed part(s) on the spot. He returned in just a couple days with the needed parts and fixed our oven perfectly. Mr. Appliance also warranties their repairs, including parts and labor. The repairman, Troy Hill, was so kind, professional, and explained everything thoroughly. I would definitely call them again should I ever have another need for an appliance repair. I recommend them highly!

resp.text: Thank you!

The Service Professional, Mr. Jordan McDade,

Betty Monroe

text: Excellent service all the way from first call to completion! Josh did a great job, quickly diagnosing the problem and explaining as he went along...even had needed part in truck! Will definitely call again with any appliance issues!

name: Jeremy Johnston
text: I scheduled a service w/Mr. Appliance based on the high ratings they have on Google Reviews.  I'm happy to report that i too had a terrific experience.  I had a freezer icing up and my repairman Chase diagnosed and fixed the issue of a bad seal in 20 minutes.  He was careful not to get water everywhere while doing the repair by putting down towels.  He put everything back as it was before he arrived.  He wore shoe protectors to not track anything in the house, and when he had to run out to his truck for a tool, he first removed those protectors and left them outside the front door so as not to get them overly dirty when he was outside.  That kind of attention to detail told me he was a professional and conscientious worker, and that Mr. Appliance trains their team to do even the little things like that right.    I'm a first-time customer and they'll be my first call next time I need appliance service.

resp.text: Thank you!!

name: Lora Smith
text: Only reason I hesitate to give 5 stars is because I was charged for a 2 hour labor for a job that took about 30 minutes maybe. Otherwise everything was very smooth and the staff and technician were professional and courteous.

resp.text: Thank you!

text: Ben repaired our oven quickly and was professional and considerate .

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Chris Pearce
text: Great communication with this company. They contacted me to confirm appointments and when my part was ordered and expected to arrive. They also called when the technician was on the way with an ETA. Josh was friendly and professional. He was concerned and careful with my hardwood floors, as he had to move the fridge. The price was a little higher than I expected, but with the great service, I wouldn't complain.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Pamela Presley
text: Ben was on time the first visit and again when he returned the next day with the oven part. Great service. I’ll definitely use them again.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Richie Bruce
text: Our dishwasher was leaking but not sure of the source.  I called Mr. Appliance at the number listed in Google, and spoke to a friendly, real person!  We were able to schedule an appointment for the next morning.  The repairman, Houston, arrived ahead of schedule with a call ahead from the dispatcher letting me know he was on the way.  Houston wore a mask (COVID-19 safety precaution) as well as protective booties over his work boots.  He was very courteous, professional, and knowledgeable.  He quickly diagnosed the problem, provided a quote to repair on the spot, and upon my approval, began his work immediately, by going to get the parts and returning quickly.  The job was completed in a timely manner with care and attention to detail, at a very fair price.  I highly recommend Mr. Appliance Over the Mountain to anyone with appliance repair needs.

Repairman was very understanding and said he would request office to refund back down to $99 diagnostic charge, which they did in a few days. Ordered a new dishwasher and dishes are clean again!  Thanks to management for reasonable refund policy!  Will use them again!

The only problem I had was with  a company policy that charges a service fee of $99. I could understand that amount if the tech had to  return to bring parts back. In my case he would not be returning to replace parts. I felt the charge was high.

name: Dorann Tanner
text: Read through reviews before you call! I wish I had! Common theme- OVERPRICED! Quoted me over $450 to repair heating element in dryer. Tech said it was because the part cost over $300. I thought that was too high so I paid diagnostic fee of $99 and decided to call around. 1st company I called said “No way, that’s outrageous”- looked up my dryer and said $263 for service, repair, and part. Part is less than $175. I called back to see if they could match and they said my dryer is harder to work on than other dryers so that’s why it is more. Do not use. Call around!

resp.text: I’m sorry to hear you think our services are overpriced. In looking at this Work Order, we actually quoted the entire heating element assembly, which is a more reliable repair than just replacing the actual element within the assembly. We also use OEM parts straight from the manufacturer, so you know you aren’t getting a cheaper knockoff part. On top of that, we include a 1- year parts and labor warranty on our work. Our competitors only offer warranties anywhere between 30-90 days, max. Therefore if that assembly were to fail in 10 months, we would cover that completely, whereas the company that quoted you $263, likely would not. I hope this clears up some questions you may have about our business. Thanks for the feedback.

text: Great experience with Mr Appliance! Our washing machine stopped mid cycle so I called Mr Appliance. The tech I think his name was Witten arrived exactly when scheduled and had our washer up and running in under 20 minutes!! Great service!!

name: Jasper Odell
text: Price gougers. I was charged $191 for a 10 minute job that involved melting the ice in my refrigerator drain. I wasn't even given a quote before they started work, otherwise I would have said NO to this insane pricing. The receipt itself doesn't even give me a breakdown of the price, only $191 for minor cosmetic repair. This is my 2nd time hiring this company and they were able to quote me before starting work on the first job. The second job was absurdly priced and they got away with it due to their high service fee and no quote upfront. Their $79 'diagnostic fee' and dodgy work authorization are major red flags to be avoided. There are numerous other 1 star reviews complaining about their price gouging on unsuspecting customers, I should have read all of the reviews before hiring and not just looked at the 5 star rating. I called the supervisor (Derek) to let him know that I was overcharged and never received a quote before the work started. He said he would return my call and never returned my call about the issue -- unprofessional all the way through.

resp.text: Jasper, I apologize you feel this way. It is our policy to provide quote before work is done, so I will certainly look into this and address it to the technician to avoid it in the future. If you look at other service fees in this field by other service companies, I think you will find our diagnostic fee is very comparable and reasonable.

name: D One
text: I'm all about good, quality customer service and this company has it. Not only did I get a call to confirm my appointment but I also received a text when the technician was 30 minutes away. They sent a pic of the technician as well so I would be aware of who exactly was coming to my house (no scams) "Larry" was on time, courteous and friendly. The issue was diagnosed and the cost was a little higher than expected but I figured that's the case with LG washers. Afterwards, "Larry" explained how we should maintain upkeep to prevent future issue. He was in and out in 1 hour. That was a month ago and so far all is well with my washer. I give Mr. Appliance 4.5 stars and would recommend to friends and family.

resp.text: Thanks for your business and any future recommendations! Larry is one of the best in the business! This is the level of customer service our business is built on!

name: Brandon Powell
text:
I had already taken apart my dishwasher to try and diagnose myself. In the process of taking apart the machine I realized the rubber gaskets on some parts were stretched out and I needed new parts so I called in Mr. Appliance to finish the job. Initially they wanted to replace the gaskets AND a pump which was working fine, so I told the tech just to do the gaskets which cut the cost in half. For gaskets that I later found online for roughly $20/per (I needed 2), they charged me $205 for parts and labor. I guess that's the cost of having someone else do the job!

The dishwasher now works fine again, but the technician did not screw my dishwasher back into the cabinetry correctly, so the door doesn't shut as sturdily as it did before. I plan on calling Mr. Appliance in the next few days to ask them to come out and correct this since it was part of the job.
**I ended up calling Mr. Appliance to tell them about the dishwasher not being installed correctly, and I asked for a different technician. They sent someone out who was more professional and he cleaned up the job to my satisfaction at no charge.

name: Ryan
text: They have always been straightforward with us. When it's cheaper to replace the appliance than repair it, they've been honest with us about it. They communicate well and are always on time. We were sad to hear about the loss of their repairman Tony.

name: Brett Clark
text: I recently used MA for a stove repair. As with a previous dryer repair, they arrived on time, very professional looking, quoted and repaired my issue with no hassle. I have referred them to several friends. I will use them again and again! Great company and well done job!

name: Amanda Moulin
text: I normally do not write reviews, but I have to share my experience. I called on last Friday to see if/when they had availability to come look at my dryer. The office staff seemed nice, scheduled me the same day, $79.00 diagnostic fee which would be waived if we do the service needed with them. I told the woman scheduling the service that my dryer was giving us the "FE" error code, which when I googled it meant it needed a new electronic control board or it could be the fuse which is often mistaken as the electronic board error, both being "FE". She assured me that their technician would do a thorough diagnostic check to ensure they ordered the right parts, etc... The technician arrived 20 minutes outside of the 1-3 window, which I was fine with considering it was same day service. He went into the laundry room, pushed some buttons on the dryer, got on his tablet, searched the error code "FE", then 5 minutes later told me I needed a new electronic control board and with parts/labor it would be $384.00, jaw dropped. I asked how he knew what was wrong because he had not taken one part off, did not check the electronic board or the fuse, he then raised his voice telling me that there was nothing to check, it was the electronic board, gesturing to the error code. The tech seemed very agitated with me and I explained I was not questioning how he does his job, rather asking how he knew what was wrong because he only googled exactly what I did which said it could be either the board or fuse. At this point my brother who was visiting came to the laundry room after he heard him raising his voice and asked him about the fuse as well and got the same response. The tech then asked if we wanted to proceed with the parts ordered, which I replied no and he said ok it will be $79.00, he spent 10 minutes total in my house including talking to me and did not do a thorough diagnostic check. After he left, my brother who actually works on computers, ordered a new electronic board from Amazon for $36.00, it arrived, he changed it out after watching a YouTube video and shock shock it did not work. He then took the entire dryer apart to get to the fuse (which is why I think the tech did not want to spend time doing it on a Friday), tested the fuse which showed the fuse was out, ordered a new fuse from Amazon for $7.00, arrived today, put it in the dryer with the old electronic board, and magic, it works! Now we are sending back the electronic board to Amazon we ordered since it was not the electronic board and we spent $7.00 vs $384.00 on this repair. Very disappointed that I spent $79.00 for a tech to shout at me and not do any actual checks or work.

Cost of the service visit was reasonable. This was second time using them and would do so again.

I'm guessing the majority of their customers are clumsy people and the elderly.

resp.text: Billy,  I apologize you feel our services are not of value. We service thousands of people in the Birmingham area each year and take pride in our customer service. I will look into this call to see what can be done for future service calls, but it is not our goal to take advantage of anyone.

name: Donna Pike
text:
After a frustrating day of searching for someone to fix my Kenmore Elite fridge, made by LG, a friend recommended Mr. Appliance,ie, Jeremy Cowan.
Jeremy came, on time, he was so respectful of us and our home.
I cannot tell you how refreshing it was to have Jeremy here to fix our fridge.
No mumbo-jumbo!
He diagnosed the problem,  gave us the price, let us decide, ordered the parts on Wednesday, back today, Friday, fixed the problems, fast efficient, all the right tools, but most of all, knowledgeable,  so nice, answered all of our questions, and assured us, if we have any problems or questions do not hesitate to call the office.
As he left, Tim and I were satisfied and happy, and grateful.
We hope Jeremy is a valued employee, we value him and Mr. Appliance!!
The office personnel is also outstanding!
Kept us updated on times.
I wish your name included location, Mr. Appliance in Irondale.
Donna Pike
440 East Ventura drive.
Irondale.

resp.text: Thank you so much for this great review as well as your business, Donna! Jeremy is a great asset to our team and we are lucky to have him. I will most certainly relay these kind words to him. Please let us know if you need anything in the future!

name: Dawn DeGweck
text: while friendly, the service was not helpful. The technician who came to fix my oven diagnosed the problem as several internal fuses nonfunctioning and the control panel needing replacement. After waiting four weeks with no oven working, I was told that they could not locate a control pane, and it was on backorder, which could take through July. The bill would be close to $700. I called another local company. The technician pulled out my stove from the wall and found the connector cord had failed. If an electrical appliance does not work, don't we need to see if the power is connected? He replaced the cord. The oven works. the bill was about $200. Work accomplished in one business day. Shoddy work, Mr. Appliance.

text:
Okay, so I had an appointment with this company today. I rushed home to make sure that I would be here on time, which I was. I waited and waited and nobody showed up. I called to confirm that they were coming and the receptionist assured me that they would call when they were on their way. Another 2 hours went by and still no call and no service person. Then, I called again and the receptionist told me the same thing. It is now 9 PM at night and not a single call or service person. This is BEYOND unprofessional. I WOULD NOT recommend.

Update: At 9:06 PM someone from the company called me and apologized. Said that somehow the tech wasn't notified of the service call. I had made the appointment the week prior, so I'm not sure how that happens. I appreciate the call to apologize, but I still would not recommend them. I had to rearrange my whole afternoon to be here during their "time frame" and then sat here waiting.

text: Its Alabama power. They are really the worst. My bill keeps going up and we honestly have changed are habits except to try and cut cost. But that just doesn't seem to work. You ask them to look into it and they don't care. They just give you excuses and reasons why it might be so high, but not willing to actually look into it.

name: Tina Thornton
text: I went after I paid my bill at a previous address and took 450. 00 deposits as the 800 # told me too to put power on in my name at my trailer here in Jacksonville. They have on file that I'm on oxygen 24 hours a day. I owe a large bill from a different address years ago and had made 50.00 money payments on it. But still owe. The 800 # said it wouldn't be a problem that I just take my money and confirmation and they would work with me again on the big bill. So I get there when the door opens at 8:15 a.m. go to the older lady teller she leaves her desk goes in the back for 15 minutes I waited she comes out with her hand on her hip standing behind a tall skinny man with brown hair a supervised. He never said his name. He was very rude and demeaning said no I will not work with you on this bill, I DONOT care that you are on oxygen, and I DONOT care if you are on disability either. Before this power is put in your name you have to pay 2,223.57 ! Plus a 450.00 deposit. I was in tears the power was on at that point. I begged I even tried to just set up my card that my disability comes on for autopsy for my old bill and new ones. But he was very very rude loud and mean. I cried walking out the door. Very bad. Customer service, not friendly at all. Not understanding of people's disabilities or life situations. An hour after I was home on January the fifth this happened, they came and cut off my power. Knowing everything! In January! Winter. Alabama power is hurtful and hateful! The bill was originally 1490.00 they added all kinds of service fees LTE fees plus turned it over to collec5ions for more fees Wich put it up over 2200.00! Not to mention in 2013 I filed chapter seven bankruptcy and this was supposed to have been put in my depts owed as well.😥😥😥 I am very hurt and now have no idea when I'm going be able to get my power on. Prepaid power is in part of Jacksonville, but Alabama power has a monopoly hold in the area that I live!

name: Emily Miles
text: We are currently remolding a house and choose to use Bob Wallace for all our appliances. Seeing the house is located in Rogersville Florence was the best location for us. It is a smaller store. However, after calling we spoke with a salesman by the name of Anthony. He was very helpful, I let him know we were looking for Kitchen aid appliances and wanted to see/touch them before purchasing. I gave him the item numbers and he let me know he had a few of them on the floor in a different color.  So headed out and met with him and looked over everything in stock, decided on our purchase which totaled up to around 15K, but then Anthony worked his magic and we left writing a check for 10k! So not only was Anthony helpful he saved us quite a bit of money!  I highly recommend Bob Wallace!

In 2 hours time 2 STRONG young men came to install it and tested it and showed me how it works!  Dakota was great as was his partner with the curly hair. text: A huge waste of time AND MONEY!!! This man  DOES NOT STAND BY HIS WORK. DOES NOT REFUND YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY  WHEN HE DOES NOT REPAIR YOUR  ITEM. YOU WILL  STILL HAVE A BROKEN ITEM AND LOSE MONEY.  VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!!! MY opinion  a total SCAM  ARTIST.  TAKES MONEY AND DOESN'T REPAIR  YOUR ITEM!!   How can you  do people like that?? I hope karma  treats you the way you treat your customers. You sir are what is wrong with this world, people trust you to do  the job you are paid to do, fix their items. Instead you don't fix their item and keep their money. In my opinion  that is stealing, you didn't earn the money!!!!

text: Great job on my amp repair.  I think it works better than when new.  Very professional  and prompt service.  I highly recommend Frankie for complex repairs.

name: Dori Long
text: My husband paid this man to fix his welder circuit board. He DID NOT  fix the circuit board AND  kept our money. Didn't stand behind his work or his word. Will be reported to the better business bureau !!

name: Aaron Smith
text: Very friendly and experienced! I would recommend franky to anyone that needs repair done. Great job Thank You very much.

name: tim long
text: Do not bring anything to Frankie for repair. I hired him to repair the circuit board in my welder. Paid him for the job, which only half of it was done. Asked him to replace all of the capacitors on the board. He did not. He left a diode that he had cut loose. The soldering was the worst looking hack jobs I have ever seen. He picked up the board and was paid $90 initially to check it on the machine. I had to drive to Dothan to retrieve it from him and paid the balance of $145. Installed the board and the welder has no output at all now. Originally agreed upon price was $220. When I got the board back the diode was never reconnected, the solder joints were ridiculously poor. And the welder still does not work. He came out and wanted another $25 to “check” the board again. He came and “checked” the board again. He said there is another bad part on the board. How could there be another bad part if he checked the whole board. So after seeing the poor workmanship displayed. I asked for a partial refund. He said no. So now I am out $235 and my welder still doesn’t work. If I had only known that he couldn’t do the job to start with, I would never have hired him to do it. This guy does not know what he is doing! Please save your hard earned money. Seek out a professional. Don’t get screwed like I did!

name: rob merritt
text: Frankie is a hack and a tool at best. He is not a man of his word. He thrives on only doing part of the job, so that you call him for extra costly service calls. Also not impressed with his Harbor Freight soldering gun (which he isn't very proficient with) . His guarantees are worthless. POS

name: stephanie phillips
text: Did a great job on the repair you did on our juke box.. thanks again

name: Cynondria
text:
He never showed up. I called Frankie at 10 am to get my tv fixed. We set up an appointment at 4 the same day. I drove from Daleville with a 60 inch tv (very heavy to lug down a flight of stairs during a storm) to get it fixed. When we got there it was a little past 4 so I called him on his phone. He said he was on a service call and to wait for him til 5. Okay sure. So we drove around for a bit before coming back at 5. We tried calling but he wouldn’t answer pick up.we waited out there til 6:25 and tried calling a few more times before giving up. If you run a Business and set up an appointment please be professional about it. Because not only did you waste my time but you wasted my gas and that’s money. :/ the least that could have been done was to set up an appointment for another day or at least tell us you were too busy or something. Ignoring customers is not the answer.

Edit 1/3: he messaged us to repair our tv a few days after the above incident. We let him take it. He stole our tv and closed his business. What a scam. I will be coming over to the business to claim the television set we left there

name: Willie Thornton
text: He's a good guy when it comes to help on ur electronic

text: Great repair work on a 25 year old Only FM receiver. Thanks!

name: Mark Given
text: Frankie repaired my old 70’s Marantz receiver back to new. Great work, quick turnaround and all at a fair price.

name: Layna Cook
text: Awesome service . fast and friendly!! Highly recommend!!!

name: Bryan Dawkins
text: Fast friendly service, with quality work!!!!

name: Gigi Smith
text: I have used them a couple of times over the years and was satisfied with their work.   But almost a year ago we had them replace a part on our ice machine    It did not fix it, I called and was told someone would call back to schedule a return visit to see what could be done.   I called numerous times and left messages after that and to date, no call back, no return visit, nothing.   So we are out 258.00 and no ice maker.   I’m disappointed as I have recommended them over the years.   I’m very disappointed.

name: Sonja Hood
text: I used this company to repair my dishwasher. They called me right away to fix my dishwasher and they scheduled me within the same week. They were prompt and very professional when they came to my home. Tri County assessed the problem with my dishwasher and they fixed it in the first try. I will continue to use this company and recommend them to all of my family and friends. THIS COMPANY IS AWESOME AND HAS EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

name: RDT 64
text: Service call arranged through warranty company.  I called them when they did not call within the 24 window only to have the associate tell me, at length, about how overworked the associate was.  While discussing my appliance problem, the associate was confrontational, rude and condescending, interrupting several times and lecturing me like I was a 5 year old.  When I finally, interrupting the associate for once, asked if they were going to do the service or if I needed to get someone else the associate said dismissively that it's my call.  I said "goodBYE" and hung up.  The overworked associate then somehow managed to find the time to cancel the work order before I could get it reassigned, forcing me to go through the entire process again.  Will.  Never.  Go.  To.  Them.  Again.

name: Eric Eaton
text: Find someone else.  They looked at our fridge and the fan was broke.  They said they would order it.  Had to call twice to remind them.  When they came back, water dispenser was broke.  My wife correctly identified the line was frozen.  They said it was not and instead insisted we buy a new filter.  We bought it through amazon instead of them because of the aforementioned incompetence at ordering a new part.  Put the new one in and surprise, it still did not work.  I had to take apart the door myself and thaw the line.  These people are the worse.  Call them and they act like you, the customer, is an inconvenience.  Our rental agency uses them so we do not have a choice.  But if you have a choice, go with someone else.  Heck, my wife did a better job identifying the issue than these amateurs.

name: Mary Kiker
text: The whole thing was seamless and a great value.  I was told that the technician would be there before 10 and 12, and I received a text message that the guy was on the way shortly before 10.  At exactly 10:00 Steven showed up. He did his thing for about a half hour or so and charged us a very fair price.  The appliance is fixed and we couldn't be happier.  I even felt compelled to call them later to let them know just how great of a job they did.  I would not hesitate to contact them again.

name: Tim spradlin
text: Great place to get your appliance fixed

name: Dorothy Priest
text: Very little diagnostics performed because two people were needed to lift microwave down.

name: Michelle Newell
text: If I could give no stars I would.  We have worked with this company for over 4 months to get my dishwasher fixed.  It is still not fixed.  They have misdiagnosed the problem, ordered and installed the wrong parts, cancelled appointments, and will not reschedule my appointment.

name: Fredrick Turner
text: I'm not the one to write reviews, but my experience with this company has been bad. We read these reviews prior to going with this company and our insurance company American Home Shield assured us that this vender was reliable so I trusted their word. So with that said, it's been almost 3 weeks and our dryer is still out of commission. They showed up today to fix it, and the part was broken. Go figure. I called, the lady immediately put me on hold. I hope it gets better.

name: Buzz Sawyer
text: Everything went great!

name: Louie Bell III
text: It's too bad you cannot give 0 stars. This place is terrible. Techs that do not know their job, lies lies lies. Billing warranty company for a motor that is not needed, then after a week of waiting for it , thay call to schedule time to come out,. I take off work only for the fools to call and cancel saying "the part is broken  we will have to reorder" .. How do companies like this exist?

name: Raquel Hosea
text: Took them forever to come back to fix my appliance, and they put parts in wrong. My insurance company had to call another company to come out.

name: Jenna Richards
text: Let me tell you about this company. This is who American Homeshield sent out to fix our dishwasher. They've been out four times in the last two months--8 times total in the last year. We've told them exactly what the problem is - the dishwasher does not drain the last cycle. I've even come home an hour before the appointment and turned on the dishwasher so they can see that it's not draining. They have put in two timers and the other times basically just looked at it and did nothing. It needs to be replaced. So now they've requested for American Homeshield to send another company out to look at it. So a service fee and lots of missed work for absolutely NOTHING. They simply don't care. I wish I'd just bought a new one months ago to avoid all this hassle. I'm not sure who is worse though--this company or American Homeshield.

name: Rock Starship
text: The technician fixed one problem with my microwave but did not do a function check. When other problems were evident the technician returned to determine additional parts were required but after 2 weeks could not be found, and would not answer the phone or return phone calls.
